campaign.story:
Kris Sowersby: The Art of Letters 
A visual feast of letterforms by one of the world’s leading type designers.
We are surrounded by letters. Yet how do we perceive them? Are we even conscious of it? For a type designer, letters are something they consider every day. Their relationship to letterforms is intimate and complex.
Kris Sowersby of Klim Type Foundry lives such a life. He is one of the world’s most celebrated type designers.
The book Kris Sowersby: The Art of Letters examines Sowersby’s letter drawing practice while considering the characters as independent works of art, exploring their interconnections of function and style. It celebrates the absurd beauty involved in creating multiple expressions of predetermined alphabets through nuance and theory. 
While a typeface is a well considered set of many elements, if one removes the context of language systems and alphabets, each character may be viewed as a singular abstract drawing. A type designer spends their days drawing these characters, one at a time, as black form on white ground. Through this practice they become immersed in the relationships of form and the minutiae involved in every drawing of every letter.
As Sowersby has expressed, “There is no definitive form of the alphabet. The alphabet is a concept made concrete through countless written and designed letterforms; the alphabet is not defined by a single typeface but expressed through all of them. There’s sets of rules, largely unwritten rules, of how a typeface is put together, about relationships between letterforms and between styles. It’s a balance between a hard system and flexibility.”
If we look at letters individually, and repetitively, what do we see? Most people don’t see a typeface when reading words, yet we learn early on what letters look like, and we can recognise them across multiple styles. When looking at the output of Kris Sowersby, different letterforms perfected day after day, the characters become art in their own right, allowing us to re-see, or to see for the first time, their individual form and beauty. 
The Book
Kris Sowersby: The Art of Letters will feature 750 large character illustrations selected from Klim typefaces including Calibre, Domaine, Founders Grotesk, Heldane, National, Signifier, Söhne and Untitled. Printed one per page in powerful black on white, the drawings provide a visceral insight into the life of a type designer.
The book will be designed by Mark Gowing and published by Formist Editions. It will feature an introduction by Gowing and a critical essay by Paul McNeil, graphic designer, writer and educator. A detailed catalogue of Klim fonts will provide typographic context for the out of context letter illustrations. Sowersby and Gowing are collaborating on a custom typeface that will be used to typeset the book.
About Kris Sowersby
Director of the Klim Type Foundry, Kris Sowersby is one of the world’s most celebrated type designers. Along with his popular library of commercial fonts, Sowersby has also designed custom typefaces for commissioners including The Financial Times, PayPal and National Geographic.
Sowersby has received numerous awards and accolades, including a Certificate of Excellence from the New York Type Directors Club; named an ADC Young Gun in 2010; accepted as a member of the prestigious Alliance Graphique Internationale in 2013; and receiving the John Britten Black Pin in 2015, the highest award given by the Designers Institute of New Zealand. In 2019, Sowersby was named an Art Laureate by The Arts Foundation for his continuing contribution to New Zealand Art and Design.
The Design
Kris Sowersby: The Art of Letters will be designed by Mark Gowing, founder of Formist. formist.co
Formist is a publisher, a type foundry and a design studio. As creative director of Formist, Gowing utilises over 30 years as an industry leader specialising in design. Commissioners have included the Sydney Opera House, Kaldor Public Arts Projects, Warp Records, the Australian War Memorial, Hopscotch Films, Preservation Music and the Australian Council for the Arts. His passionate involvement in the publishing and arts industries has resulted in a wealth of experience in design, content curation, publishing and product development.
Gowing’s work has been exhibited and published around the world. He has been honoured with solo exhibitions at the 22nd International Poster Biennale in Warsaw, Poland, the Divieto D’Affissione in Turin, Italy and Monash University in Melbourne, Australia. Gowing is a member of the Alliance Graphique Internationale and his work is held in numerous institutional collections including the Cooper Hewitt Smithsonian Design Museum in New York.

The money raised from this Kickstarter campaign will fund the writing and editing of all the text, alongside the design, production and printing of the book.
About Formist Editions – The Publisher
Since 2014, Formist Editions has been committed to creating high quality book, prints and artworks for lovers of art and design. We aspire to make content that is engaging, progressive and beautiful.
We have published over a dozen books to date, covering the spectrum of art and design. Publications have included: Ficciones Typografika: 1642, awarded in the 2019 Tokyo Type Directors Club Awards; Gemma Smith: Found Ground, shortlisted for the 2018 Cornish Family Prize for Art and Design Publishing and Stephen Ormandy: Only Dancing, awarded in Design Observer’s 2017 50 Books | 50 Covers.
Editorially, Formist is passionate and direct. We wish to inform the reader without pretence and maintain a point of view that is thoughtful and accessible. Formist books are tactile and beautiful, while remaining relevant and informative.
When creating a publication, we meticulously produce all aspects of the project, from concept through editorial and design, to fabrication, marketing and distribution.

updates.update_content:
We're thrilled to be able to make Kris Sowersby: The Art of Letters a reality, through the backing of our wonderful supporters. We are incredibly grateful.  
We are excited to be able to focus on the next steps, which include the selection of the 750 glyphs to appear in the book; graphic designer, educator and writer Paul McNeil can begin the critical essay and Kris Sowersby and Mark Gowing will continue collaborating in the creation of a custom typeface to appear in the publication.

Firstly, thank you all so much. We're 85% funded and thrilled with the support. We wouldn't be here without you. It's looking very good for the book to become a reality with a week left of the campaign. We got this!
We wanted to share a sneak peek of the unprinted book dummy, so you can see what a good-looking brick of letters the book will be. This is only a mockup at this stage, so the cover will be printed and lovely on the final product.

We’re 65% funded and we’re over the moon!
We’re celebrating by offering our wonderful supporters the opportunity to choose a glyph to appear in the book. That’s right, you can choose your favourite glyph to appear in Kris Sowersby: The Art of Letters, and be credited in the book for your efforts.
Any glyph that Kris Sowersby has designed can be chosen. There’s several hundred thousand to choose from!
If you’re amazing and have already backed the book but also want to choose a glyph, you can select that as a single option.
These rewards are limited so jump in quick if you’re interested.  
We’re very curious what glyphs our supporters will choose!

Hello from Formist and thank you for being an early backer of Kris Sowersby: The Art of Letters. We’re off to a good start. After seven days we’re 30% backed, with three weeks to go. It’s all or nothing though, so any help in spreading the word would warm the cockles of our hearts.
We thought we’d share a picture of some of the research that has gone into putting the concept together. Formist’s Mark Gowing and brilliant type designer Dave Foster (of Foster Type) came up with the idea to try to capture an abstract portrait of a type designer’s life. So far they have trawled through over 250,000 glyphs to make a short list of the characters for the book, and they’re not finished yet. Take a look at this stack of A3 research pages with numerous glyphs on each page. A daunting task but undertaken for the love of letters!

campaign.story:
WELCOME!!!
Thank you for your interest in this project. 
We are very proud and excited to share it with you!
Pocket Smiles put simply is a pocket book designed to make you smile.
Profits from our sales will be donated to Black Dog Institue and will be used for mental health education programs, support and awareness.

Watch the video below to learn more about the Pocket Smiles project.
PLAY

(Filmed and edited by Hugh Mckay, www.mountainduckmedia.com.au )


HERE IT IS!
The goal of Pocket Smiles is to help break the stigma surrounding mental health, while making the topic more approachable. Instead of adding to this stigma by focusing on big scary statisics and confronting stories, we are using smiles as our vehicle to shed light on this very important aspect of life.

We are doing this by using humour to break down barriers and inspiration to drive change.

The book consists of jokes, quotes, art and things to try all designed to make you smile, laugh, or feel just good. To make this book even more special, every joke and quote is accompanied by a custom artwork by a different artist.

WHY THE BIG FUSS?
There is a serious need not only in Australia, but all around the world for improved awareness and education on mental health. 
Here is a snapshot of the impact that mental illness has in Australia:
Provided by Black Dog Institute

WHY SMILES?
We believe that a smile is the most simple and pure form of positive mental health.
When we smile we bring ourselves into the present. We are appreciating the little moments of joy that we face in day to day life. 

It is proven that when you smile (even a forced smile) it makes you feel happier, as well as being highly contagious. If you dont believe me try to watch this video without smiling!
PLAY

I don’t think it’s hard to believe that the more we can salute the little moments of joy in our lives with a smile, the happier we will be.

THE ORIGIN
Hi! My name is Hugh, how do you do?
I am a 26 and I live in Torquay, Vic.

Pocket Smiles comes from a love of learning about mental health which can be traced back to one single event 5 years ago. I was coward punched in the head while at a friends party on the Gold Coast, I fell back and hit my head again on the concrete resulting in a brain injury.

The hit had many ongoing consequences. All of the scars have healed though it was my mental health that took the biggest hit in the form of depression and anxiety. I still frequently have to manage my anxiety, from severe panic attacks to everyday stressors.

My recovery took a lot longer than it should have which was all due to me not knowing enough about how to manage my mental health. Mental health was not a topic of conversation in my life and I knew very little about it. I decided to dedicate myself to learning, and applying my findings. 

The idea of Pocket Smiles came from wanting to create something that welcomes people  to the topic of mental health.

Addressing mental health can be very daunting because there is so much information out there, it is hard to know where to begin. We’re hoping that this book will help people to learn, address, and discuss mental health in a fun way.

WHERE WE ARE AT:
This project started early November 2018. Since then we have:
Refined the concept
Started social media accounts
Gathered content: jokes, quotes 
Got artists on board
Lost artists
Found replacement artists
Lost replacement artists
Found replacement artists for the replacement artists
Lost them
Refined content (so we needed less artists)
Gained partnerships
Assembled the book
Launched marketing campaigns
Started a Kickstarter!

WHATS NEXT:
Try and spread the word as much as possible.
Sell pre-sales of books, t-shirts, stickers and prints.
Based off of pre-sales order everything that we need.
Post merch to all of you!

LETS TALK MONEY $$$
Since the start, the idea was to use this book to support Black Dog Institute www.blackdoginstitute.org.au

The following is how the money riased will be put to use:
Provided by Black Dog Institute
MATH! 
(Based off of book sales alone)
We will be buying books in blocks of 800 copies. 
At this volume each book costs $4.78 including GST. In total it will cost $3,824.
The books are priced at $20 each, so net profit = $15.22 per book.
$15.22 x 800 copies = $12,176

With the stores we already have lined up to stock Pocket Smiles, interest from schools, and the networks of myself and all of the artists involved, I believe that we can make it to the $50,000 bracket to donate to Black Dog Institute.

EXPENSES:
Cost of goods sold - $4.78 each book
5% Kickstarter fee
10% Administration fee
Squarespace Commerce website hosting - $408

We are aiming to raise $7,500 from pre-sales to cover the cost of printing 800 copies, printing a line of t-shirts, and limited edition prints.
*Sticker printing has kindly been donated by Xibit Creative located in Torquay, Vic www.xibit.net.au

 WHAT YOU ARE PLEDGING FOR: 
PLEDGE $20 - THE BOOK:
PLEDGE $5 - STICKERS (each):
“Your Smile” Sticker
PLEDGE $40 - T-SHIRTS:
(More to come)
Johnny Cash tee by Ben Brown
Doggie tee by Shaun Gonzalez

PLEDGE $100 - PRINTS:
Artwork by Claire Johnson
Artwork by Ben Brown
Artwork by Stefan Hunt
Artwork by Annie Walter
Artwork by Doug Bennett
Artwork by Kiel Tillman
Artwork by Xavier Davies


CONCLUSION
Pocket Smiles is more than just a book.
In essence, it is about taking yourself out of a situation for a moment and choosing to find a smile in what is around you.

In the beauty you can see, the sensations you can feel, the love in your heart or the joke in your pocket.

We hope that we can someday make you smile!

Thank you for reading!

Hughie :)

campaign.story:
“No Commercial Value” is an Instagram account where I explore mildly dystopic tech-futures and absurdist design-fictions through illustration. I post droll sketches of satirical concepts ideas a few times a week, and over time they pile up in the digital ether.
I launched a Kickstarter project last year to create the first print run of No Commercial Value zines—the campaign was successful, but then took me over 6 months to get the final printed zine into people’s hands.
I’m launching this Kickstarter to create issue Nº2 of No Commercial Value. However to battle my own worst impulses, I’ll be drawing one page of the zine each day the campaign runs, so by the end of the 24 day campaign, the zine will be done. To hold myself accountable, I will time lapse screencap the drawings as I make them, and I'll be posting each day's progress as my campaign video.
If I happen to fall behind, and have not completed the drawings for the zine by the end of the campaign, I will cancel the project and refund everyone. Simple as that. I’d be pretty damn embarrassed—but perhaps that’s just what I need to get things done.

issue #2 cover
INTRODUCTION
in the company of growing women.
Dear Lois is a bi-annual independent magazine for all women, starting as young as 12-years-old. We believe we continue to grow and learn through all stages of life, so why not have a place to pursue and encourage that together.
Each issue invites everyday storytellers, casual life changers, and unassuming heroes to share their stories. In a world filled with comparing and competition, we wanted to create something different. Here you don’t need to be the best or the first at something to be given a platform to talk. We feature all voices, big and small.
We meet you where you are.
issue #2 categories
ISSUE #2
This is the home issue. We decided to focus on the theme of home because whether we feel like we’ve found it, we’ve always had it, or we are still searching for it, we all have our own definition of home.
Inside, we talk about the people who make up a home. The people who make it messy, and the people who tidy it up. We talk about the feeling of home — why some people feel uncomfortable with the home they are given, and how they discover a new home in new places. We talk about how certain memories remain in our brains forever, and how ultimately you have the ability to shape your home and create a place of belonging wherever you go.
We learn that home is much more than a physical structure. It’s about comfort and safety, a place where your true self can shine. Houses can come and go, but your home moves with you.

interview with musician Sarah Pasillas of Antonioni
written by Megan Sexton
written by Artemie Li
OUR JOURNEY
Issue #1 was fully funded on Kickstarter and since releasing the issue in November 2018 we’ve been blown away by the seemingly endless support and kind words from our growing audience. We are super proud of our first issue, which was originally a school project primarily aimed at learning more about typography and layout. However, we were clearly on to something and it caught on, becoming so much more than we ever could have imagined. It’s now found all over the world.
With issue #2, we are hoping for an even larger reach. We’ve tried out new things, met new people, and we’re ready to share these new amazing pieces with you.
So why another campaign you ask? Because printing and shipping is expensive (70% of our budget!), and Kickstarter helps us secure funds in advance while we grow organically with your support. In addition to production costs, we’ve also made a commitment to have the money necessary to pay our contributors for their time and talent. Because we are currently ad-free, we rely entirely on our readers’ support, and we find kickstarter to be a fun and safe way to gather the necessary funds.
By supporting this Kickstarter, you’ll be putting us in a better position to keep making and releasing issues, to keep growing our readership by printing more copies, and ultimately to make Dear Lois a sustainable project. The more issues we create and the more readers we gain, the more opportunities we have for grants and sponsorships in the future.
illustrated by Blobs Feeling Things
written by Josephine Edmondson and Lauren Gallow
written by Olivia Driggs
WHY PRINT
There is a lot of great work online, and we hope to add to that space sometime in the future. However, we strongly value the idea of sitting with the work within Dear Lois for as long as you need. You can take it with you wherever you go, or you can keep it on your bookshelf until you need to revisit it later on. While Dear Lois isn’t considered a self-help publication, we understand certain articles will impact different people at different times. Consider it a friend you can call on when you need someone.

As always, projects like this take a village, and Dear Lois issue #2 is no exception. 
Our sincerest thank you to all our contributors:
Artemie Li, Adrienne Oliver, Alejandra Macouzet, Amy Huber, Anna Nguyen, Bonnie Alderfer, Breeze Pollard, Dayna Behrens, Divya Das, Ella Lama, Ellen C. Caldwell, Gulligull, Enya Last, Emilie Jajonie, Blobs Feeling Things, Jen Garcia, Jessica Bose, J.W. To all our friends and family, thank you. Truly couldn’t do any of this without you.
And finally, our deepest thanks goes to our Grandmother Lois, the magazine's namesake. Dear Lois is our way of sharing our desire to connect all generations of women together and to pay tribute to one the strongest ladies who ever existed. She was also one of the most talented crafters we will ever meet, and we can't think of a better way to spend our creative energy than by producing this magazine for years to come.

ABOUT US
Dear Lois grew a little bigger this time around, and now it's 100% a sister dream team. Mariah Behrens is a graphic designer, illustrator, and toy maker, insistent on always finding ways to empower young people. Hannah Behrens joined the team and has been an incredible second eye throughout the process of building issue #2. Hannah is a fitness guru with all the knowledge on oils, acupuncture and self-care you could ever need. 
read more on our IG: @dearlois_mag

updates.update_content:
Yesterday our campaign ended and we successfully not only reached our goal but we exceeded it!
I’m still mostly speechless, but here we go: Thank you so much to everyone — from all the countless shout outs, to sticking with us despite the waterfall of daily social media postings on our end, and of course, to pledging. We couldn’t have done any of this without you all.
For now, I am off to a weekend of camping and a much needed unplugging from the internet. But before then I have one announcement! I’ve received numerous messages from people saying they were unable to pledge to our Kickstarter for a variety of reasons. As of this morning we have copies of issue 1 + pre-orders to issue 2 and a couple pieces of merch . Consider it an extension of the Kickstarter, but without the countdown!

Last update before we are HOPEFULLY successfully funded! We've got 24 hours, people!
We are so insanely grateful for all the pledges we've gotten so far (223!!) and for all the shoutouts and continuous sharing of the campaign you all have been doing. It takes a village, and we like this village :) 
So please, continue sharing with your friends and family if you can. Just a little bit longer! We appreciate all the help, big and small.

BIG NEWS. Our DL crowd has spoken and we’ve decided we couldn’t leave issue 1 hanging without a commemorative enamel pin to go with it! We just love the enamel pin for issue 2 and think it would be fun to have one with every issue from here on out!
SOOOO, here we are announcing a few new reward options! 
Issue 1 + issue 2 + enamel pins for both! $60

Okay y’all, this is it. No turning back. We have entered the last 5 days, the homestretch. 
I know, I know, you must be tired of me continuously blabbing about this campaign, but hey, after these 5 days we will shut up and (hopefully) go back to finishing the second issue of the magazine and hitting PRINT. But until then, there’s no doubt we’re going to go all in, and we’re hoping you join us! We’re so grateful for all of you who have stuck by us on this journey and we hope you will continue to share and support this campaign. Let’s cross that finish line hand in hand!

Here we thought it’d be fun to talk about future plans. In other words, with your pledges and readership, here are the things we will be able to prepare for in the future:
More issues! We don’t have themes set in stone yet, but some ideas we are exploring include friendship, femininity, health, movement, boundaries, grief, anger, joy, work, food, change, and on and on and on. 
Sponsors! Whenever our readership grows and we are able to show more work (aka more issues), we get that much closer to being able to explain why it’d be worthwhile for people and companies to sponsor our future issues! Which would in turn mean less stressful pre-order campaigns and focusing more on the work that truly means the most to us: the actual magazine.

Hello again!
We are officially beyond the halfway point and there’s no turning back or slowing down time! 
Thank you to the 121 backers we’ve received so far. And thank you to the countless number of friends and family and internet pals alike who have given us shoutouts on social media and shared the campaign with their friends. It takes so much more than me simply shouting into my own social voids!

campaign.story:
Please Note: Kickstarter is like a pre order for the product (the game). If you make a pledge, it's like buying the product a few weeks in advance. 
Once we hit $10K, we'll use the money from the pre orders to do the first big production run in China and send you the game. If we don't hit $10K, you get your pledge money back. We appreciate any support in helping us Kickstart this business!  
WHAT IT’S ABOUT
Cards of Candour is like a warm hug from a good friend, pulling you a little too close and whispering sweet takedowns in your ear. 
As you can see, it's a card game printed on professional-looking paper so that no one blames you for asking questions like:
WHAT’S IN THE BOX
For the detail oriented, the box contains:
280 question cards starting with “Have you ever…”
A bespoke dice that will direct the players on who to ask
Game overview and instructions
Many, many, many good times ahead

HOW TO PLAY
2-10 players, it’s good to have a mix of people you like and a couple of fringe invites that aren’t really in the inner circle.
Deal five question cards to each player, four to any lawyers because they are sneaky enough already.
Highest paid person goes first, just like in society. 
Roll the dice and relax, that tiny piece of plastic is now in control and will tell you who to read a question card to (see below for how the dice rolls).
You now get to ask that person one of the questions on the cards in front of you - if they admit it, you win the points value on the card.
Technically the first player to 10 points wins, but we all know the real winner is the person who throws the most shade.
HOW THE DICE ROLLS
That person -The arrow points to the person you ask a question, it’s like spin the bottle with optional kissing.
Double down - Double down and read two question cards to the same person, if either results in a “no” you lose both.
All in - Everyone else reads a question card about the dice roller who then picks the best card based solely on their opinion.
Pick anyone - You can pick anyone, but not yourself. Not everything is about you.

REAL FRIENDS EXPANSION
For those less concerned with boundaries.
The Real Friends Expansion is for those less concerned with boundaries and contains 50 cards that were deemed potentially too offensive or confronting for the first edition. To give you an idea, this is the sort of thing that you’re in for:
OUR STORY
Look, we've got a bit of a story but it doesn’t really matter, right? The whole point of this game is to tell your stories, not ours.
Honestly, we’ve found that the best part of this game is not the questions on the cards, it’s the stories that come out when your friends respond. 
We are all weird, now it’s time to share.

PROOF THAT IT's REAL
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Two little mice fell into a bucket of cream. The first mouse quickly gave up and drowned. The second mouse, wouldn’t quit. He struggled so hard that eventually he churned that cream into butter and crawled out. Ladies and gentlemen, as of this moment, we are that second mouse.

We've been working on this project for 18 months and have become quite close with our manufacturing and distribution partners. Ola Wang has helped us with pricing and getting our prototypes made - she's recently had some time off to spend with her new born but is back in action again to help us process our order (congratulations Ola). 

We've tested the game with both friends (and non-friends) to make sure it was a product worthy of your gigantic and/or dainty hands.

And finally our team has strong backgrounds in product development, e-commerce and fulfilment, and operations - we got you.

Believe in us, so we can believe in you, believing in us together.

hi@cardsofcandour.com for any questions ;)

campaign.story:
Phantales

What if your creative impulses were being fostered by beings from beyond your comprehension? 
What if art, and the addictions it all-too often accompanies, was the product of extra-dimensional beings who farmed human thought?
What if you learned this from your only friend, who was an enormous pink elephant in a trench coat? 
What if he offered you a job, and also zombies were there?
Phantales is what. 
Phantales is a 140 page, full-colour softcover book, collecting the first five issues of a new comic series created by two human beings in Melbourne, Australia. This Kickstarter aims to fund an initial print run, so that the ideas therein can assume corporeal form.
Phantales is about the ruinous spiral of addiction and the endless ascent of artistic creation in a tale that spans time, space, reality and genre. 
This first book, much like an explanation point placed erroneously at the start of a sentence, gets things started in head-stomping, Elvis-chasing, art gallery-attending fashion.
Try it out - download a PDF preview issue at Phantales.com
Our heroes
Frank is a big pink elephant person. He enjoys his work. He's currently on the trail of a missing person, and is helping out Mouse, who has woken up in a bit of a bad way - bandaged, with a foggy memory and general feeling that stuff has gone pear shaped.
The creators
Phantales is illustrated by Ry Wilkin and written by Stefan Delatovic. The characters have been rattling around in Ry's head for a decade. They've since set up shop in Stefan's as well.
Ry is an illustrator and animator of renown. Here's proof.
Stefan ... also exists. (Footage not found.)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If we achieve our funding goal, we are in a good position. The book has been fully written, illustrated and coloured. Once the campaign is successful, we can send to the printer post haste. 
Realistically, the risks are that we receive a high number of orders and that slows down shipping and processing, but that won't threaten the product. 
Also, there's a risk that someone who buys the Dungeons and Dragons reward lures Stefan into a trap.

campaign.story:
Throw Throw Burrito is what you get when you cross a card game with dodgeball. Try to collect matching sets of cards faster than your opponents while simultaneously ducking, dodging, and throwing squishy airborne burritos. The cards you collect earn points, but getting hit by flying burritos loses them. So clear some space and put away the antiques, because you’ve never played a card game quite like this before.
Since we created Exploding Kittens four years ago, we've been making games that bring friends and family together around a table, away from their screens. We brought this game to Kickstarter because we believe that adding a bit of physicality to game night is what comes next.
So, if you're into the idea of party games and weaponized Mexican food, please help us make this game a reality. We think you'll love it as much as we do.
Hugs and missiles,
-Elan, Matt, and the Exploding Kittens Team    
HOW DOES THIS WORK?
No Funding Goals, No Backer Goals, instead we want you to enter the Burrito Bowl! 
Compete in a series of incredible events to test your burrito themed prowess and we’ll upgrade your games for free!
Throw Throw Burrito started when our friend, Brian Spence, pitched a new game idea to us and we immediately fell in love. Over the next eight months, we worked closely with Brian to tune the game, design the cards, and destroy most of the fragile items in our homes.
The game went through many versions.
First, there was the "Mangoes with Animal Heads Phase":
Mango Pug
Then came the flying animal ideas: 
Then fruit: 
Then so many Mexican food ideas:
After finally choosing a name, Matt got to work on the cards: 
Character Exploration
Style Exploration
We wanted to put this project on Kickstarter because it's the fastest way for us to get the game into your hands and make improvements as a community. We think this game is great, but we need your help making it even better.
So if a world full of weaponized Mexican food is a world you want to live in, please back this project and help us build this game. 
With love and mad strafing skills,
- The Exploding Kittens Team
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge for our team is building the throwables. Since our Exploding Kittens campaign in 2015 (followed by Bears vs Babies, and You've Got Crabs), we've learned a lot about making cards and have shipped over 8 million decks of our games worldwide. But throwables are a new challenge. We're working with the finest toy manufacturers in the world to make sure that we deliver the best materials that are fun to throw (not too light) and don't hurt when they hit you (not too heavy).

It's also very important to us that everyone gets their game on time. We don't want this to be a campaign where you spend the next two years getting fifty emails about production updates and delays. If you back this project, we want you to start throwing burritos at your friends as soon as possible. This is why we're not offering t-shirts or other non-game related reward tiers that would make the distribution process take a lot longer. We're keeping it as simple as possible: support our project and in return we'll send you the game.

campaign.story:
Hi! We are Echo Room, an art project and music label founded by the friends and family of Fergus Miller (aka Bored Nothing, Wedding Ring Bells, and one half of Revenge Surgery, Pansy). 
As some may know, Fergus tragically lost his battle with depression in 2016. He left behind a huge and prolific back-catalogue of music. Some of it has already been released on vinyl (Bored Nothing - Bored Nothing and Some Songs), but the majority was only released digitally through Bandcamp, or not at all. One of the aims of our label is to immortalise Ferg's work in a format that people can treasure. Wedding Ring Bells is our favourite project of Ferg's outside of Bored Nothing, so we've chosen that as our first physical release, but we're hoping to release his full back catalogue slowly, over time. 
Our funding goal is based on a run of 150 records, pressed at Zenith in Melbourne, which will go into production once funding completes, in March. If demand exceeds this, we'll increase the run to compensate - so everyone who orders a record during the Kickstarter will get one in May. The limited edition pink swirl vinyl will be capped at 50 records (otherwise it wouldn't be limited!).
We also have Ferg's original artwork and CD-R covers from his Wedding Ring Bells period - we're turning these into stickers and high quality art prints. A very limited number of his CD-R covers is also available for those who are looking for a little something extra to remember Ferg by.
Any money we make over our funding goal with go towards funding future releases of Ferg's music through Echo Room. 50% of this will go towards SupportAct, a charity dedicated to supporting arists with mental illness.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk with pressing vinyl is issues in the initial acetate creation phase - this is when the initial "master" record is made, which all the other pressings will be copies of. If the test pressings come back with issues (clicks, pops, skips, distortion) the factory will need to cut a new acetate. This takes about a week per revision, and multiple revisions may be required until we get it just right. This means the pressing may be delayed by up to a month. 

We'll be giving you regular updates on how it's all going, so you'll know straight away if we need to request a new test pressing, and how long it should take.

campaign.story:
Hi! I'm Neil Slorance, a comic artist from Glasgow best known for my work on Dungeon Fun, Doctor Who and political comics. I also make an autobiographical/travelogue series called 'Modern Slorance'.
In April of this year I was lucky enough to be accepted for a month long artist's residency over in Finland! This was, of course, the perfect opportunity to work on a new book about my time there. A few months later I'm happy to say I've finished a 40-page full-colour book all about Finnish culture, food, romance, and Moomins!
The goal of this project is to fund the print costs to help bring this colourful book to life. I feel like this is my best piece of personal work to date. Every page has been traditionally inked and painted in watercolours (you can even get your hands on the originals as one of the rewards!) and I'm very happy with the book as a whole.
Here are a few pages from the book about Finnish Sauna culture! 
 I also found a new affinity for one of Finland's best known exports: Moomins and their creator Tove Jansson.
 But as well as culture, art, and food I also liked to write about the more quiet, human moments I had there.
 Rewards
The Back Catalogue! 
Backers of reward #4 will receive the three previous Modern Slorance books: Torts and Tinder, The Berlin Issue, and The Canada Issue.
Limited Edition Signed Print 
Backers of rewards #3, #4, and #5 will receive this A5 limited edition signed print.
Original Page 
Backers of reward #5 will receive an original page from the book! Original pages are drawn in ink and painted in watercolours on A4 watercolour paper.  
Stretch Goals!
If the project reaches £2000 every physical backer will receive this postcard set! 
Thanks for looking!

campaign.story:
Inlight is an intense single-player action game for PC/MAC (Steam) and Nintendo Switch.
In this action/shooter game, the sake of your tribe lies solely in your hands. Your focus, accuracy, and patience will be put to the ultimate test as you cleanse the world from its curse. Defeat legions of foes with your spells, upgrade your skills, unlock new abilities to fit your playstyle and delve into the mysterious past of the island of Az'kalar.
Only light must prevail, will you stand up to the challenge?
What can you expect?
An Immersive universe with meticulously hand-crafted 2D graphics and animations
A well-optimized game running smoothly at 60 FPS
Different difficulty settings allowing everyone to enjoy the game regardless of their skill or patience
2D hand-painted cinematics 
An original blend between genres!
A spiritual sequel
The universe and concept of Inlight are based on "Towaga", a conceptual mobile game we released 2 years ago. Inlight could be seen as the spiritual successor of Towaga, but the games are way different in many aspects. In short, Towaga was the first sketch while Inlight is the final product.
The whole game is revolving around a wave-system progression and dynamic world shifting. You must resist, advance and slay the creatures on your path to journey through Metnal's nightmares and defeat him, thus revealing what happened to the island.
In order to achieve such task, you've been gifted three spells. Casting them will cost you mana, so make sure you don't abuse it. 
THE BRIGHT BEAM: Your basic spell, cast it by moving the joystick to slay foes around you.
THE HALO BURST: Your last hope to save you from tight situations. Upgrade this spell and add various effects to it as you progress.
THE BRIGHT BLAST: The ultimate spell for crowd control. Upgrade and customize it as you see fit.
(Note: playable with PS4, Xbox, Switch Controller or Mouse)
World shifting
Your journey will take you to ancient shrines and ruins via a dynamic world shifting system.
Inlight's story takes place on the island of Az'kalar, fallen prey to the scourge of the endless night. In the middle of the day the sky suddenly turned black, and creatures from the abyss poured into the realm of the living, wreaking havoc everywhere they set foot following the orders of their master, Metnal the Voidmonger.
Az'kalar's inhabitants were no match for the swarming terror Metnal had unleashed, and soon only two survivors remained. Hidden beyond the Voidmonger's reach, Chimù and his mentor Kurro devise a plan to stop the evil god's hordes and bring the light back on the island.
Content (masks, Outfits, Items...)
We aim at creating a world filled with mysteries, ancient legends, and odd relics. A plethora of artifacts, outfits and codex entries are to be discovered throughout your adventure.
OUTFITS & SPELLS:
CODEX OF ITEMS:
2D cinematics
Animated cutscenes give life to the island and reveal the nebulous past of Az'kalar (spoiler-free example below)
Music previews
Inlight's music combines orchestral and electronic influences, giving a fresh twist to old-school game audio while maintaining a deep, mysterious atmosphere. To match the action of the game, the music follows your actions, dynamically evolving throughout your run.
Why we need funding
With Inlight we will offer you the best game experience we can create. But working on it in our spare time, as we are now, is impending our capacity to bring the game to the next level and make it a truly great game.
With your support, we'll be able to speed up the development, hire a new programmer, and dramatically enhance the experience.
Money surely helps, but if you're interested to see Inlight brought to life and can't afford to contribute to this campaign don't hesitate to share, post, and speak to your friends about our game. Every bit helps!
Who we are
We are Gabriel, Mathieu, Dario, and Daniel. The four of us work in Lausanne, Switzerland. We're a tiny indie development studio dedicated to creating hand-crafted and challenging gaming experiences for everyone to enjoy.
Add-ons
Add 5$ - Digital OST of the game + Digital Artbook (PDF)
Add 12$ - Printed Artbook (+ 8$ for EU delivery or 9$ for Worldwide)
Add 20$ - Get an original and signed artwork from the pre-production of Inlight. Each artwork will be unique to you.
Add 35$ - Get an original artwork and a series of stickers, badges and a few sketches signed by the whole team.

campaign.story:
Update
The Kickstarter campaign is now over and it has been a huge success! Thank you all so much for your support! :D
If you have missed the campaign, worry not! The game will come to Steam Early Access and itch.io next year. In order to keep track of the game, bookmark our homepage or follow us on Facebook, Discord or YouTube.
Intro
Build, manage and grow a thriving colony, discover new lands, craft legendary weapons and defeat your enemies. Kubifaktorium will feature different biomes to explore, plenty of resources to exploit, complex machinery to build and interesting production chains to master!
Demo
You can download a free demo including the first tutorial mission on itch.io. Note: The demo includes only the very first mission and does not include any of the advanced automation and transportation features, biomes, the world map etc. which the full game will include.
Key Features
Colony Building and Management
At the heart of your colony are your loyal colonists who mine resources, farm crops and craft tools and weapons. Each colonist has a different set of skills which evolves over time. Managing your colonists' needs and abilities is vital to ensure your colony's survival and prosperity.
PLAY

In the course of the campaign, you can grow your colony by recruiting or liberating castaway colonists. You can also tame and train some of the wild animals which can then perform simple tasks in exchange for a bit of food. :)   
Automation
While your colonists are very hard-working, their time is sadly limited. Fortunately, your colonists know how to craft advanced machinery which allows you to automate more and more of your production.
PLAY

PLAY

Logistics and Transportation
As your colony grows and your production hums along, transporting the resources you need becomes a bottleneck. Fortunately, Kubifaktorium features a number of different transportation systems.
The first transport system in Kubifaktorium is the zeppelin transport system. While zeppelins can only carry one good at a time, their low setup cost makes them an effective long-range method of transportation. Since they do not require a complex setup, they are the best choice when it comes to connecting distant areas like mining colonies.
PLAY

When a large quantity of goods needs to be transported over a long distance, trains are the way to go. Every train can carry multiple goods at a time, which is a great improvement over the zeppelin system.
Conveyor belts are used to connect depots, factories and refineries within a colony. They are easy to set up and can transport a high volume of goods. Overhead conveyors transport items above ground, which makes them a solid choice for dense late-game factory areas.
PLAY

Automated depots, inserters and sorting machines are there to help you store and manage all of your goods.
Explore different biomes
In the course of the campaign you explore and colonize multiple islands and encounter different biomes. Each biome features new enemies and challenges as well as new resources to discover, mine and process.
PLAY

The first three biomes are the grassland, the desert and the ashen world. More biomes will be announced and added in the future. Each biome will feature dynamic weather and environment effects.
PLAY

Weapon Crafting, Enemies and Combat
The islands you settle on are inhabited and guarded by mighty enemies and you need mighty weaponry to defeat them. The game will feature multiple weapon types, multiple tiers for each weapon (wooden, iron, steel etc.) and random properties for each crafted weapon (common, good, legendary etc.).
Kubifaktorium is an economy/transport simulation game at heart. As such, your success in combat depends on how well you do at equipping and training your colonists.
Mod Support
The game is designed to be very mod friendly and will allow players to create anything from new goods and industries to total conversions with new terrains and scenery.
Things you can add via modding include:
New items, weapons and other products.
New buildings.
New colonist models, animals and enemies.
New terrain types and biomes.
New map modifiers (e.g. terrain generation tweaks).
New dioramas (for the main menu).
Modifications of existing assets (e.g. balance changes).
New languages / localizations.
PLAY

When Kubifaktorium comes to Steam, you will be able to easily publish and manage your mods via the Steam Workshop.
PLAY

Windows, Mac and Linux support
The game will be released for Windows, Mac and Linux. The current build of the game has been tested on Linux and Windows and I will make sure to maintain compatibility throughout development. In fact, I am developing primarily under Linux, so I can pretty much guarantee that it will work. :)
Development Progress and Roadmap
Current State
Kubifaktorium has been in development for approximately one year now. The following table shows an estimation of how much progress I've made so far. The base game, which consists of things like the world generation and the main gameplay (mining, building, crafting and managing) already works quite well. Several advanced mechanics like trains depots are also already implemented. On the other hand, balancing, testing and the creation of higher tier content are still far from being finished.
Current State of Kubifaktorium.
Tl;dr: The first tier (colony building, basic production) is quite playable at this point. The rest (automation, transport systems, other biomes etc.) is buggy or unfinished and can currently only be accessed via the cheat menu.
Roadmap
The roadmap for Kubifaktorium consists of four phases. The Pre-Alpha phase, which contained the development of the base game so far, will conclude soon.
Development Phases. Important: The dates in this table are estimates.
Alpha phase: After this Kickstarter campaign ends, I will focus on three things: First, I will remove all the major bugs that surface. Second, I will improve the game's accessibility and UI based on the feedback I get from you. Finally, I will implement more game mechanics (like the world map/campaign) and add more content in general. This phase will conclude when all the major gameplay systems are implemented and sort of working.
Early Access / beta phase: In this phase I will implement the remaining planned content, work on features like modding support and polish the game in general. This phase will conclude when the game is ready to be published.
Release / post-release: After the game's release I will continue to support the game and add some smaller tweaks in bonus content patches, as I did in BossConstructor, my previous game.
Important: Please note that the dates in the table are estimates. I value quality over a fixed schedule. So when it turns out that I need more time to finish a phase or a feature I want to have in the game, I will take it. (Please also have a look at the risks section below.)

Demo
You can download a free demo including the first tutorial mission here on itch.io: https://kubifaktorium.itch.io/kubifaktorium
Note: The demo includes only the very first mission and does not include any of the advanced automation and transportation features, biomes, the world map etc. which the full game will include.
Why Kickstarter?
My intention for making a Kickstarter campaign for Kubifaktorium is twofold.
First of all: The 12.500€ goal of this campaign is obviously not enough to fund the development of Kubifaktorium. The game's development is primarily funded via the revenue from my previous game BossConstructor as well as the money and time I invest myself. Raising money allows me to invest more time in making the game, to pay freelancers and contractors as well as to pay license fees and other expenses.
Budget Plan.
My second goal for this campaign is to build a great community for Kubifaktorium early on. I want to get players involved in Kubifaktorium and let them play and test the game as soon as possible. As an indie developer I do not have the testing and QA resources many larger studios have. Therefore player feedback is a very valuable resource for me to improve the game. With a bug reporting tool, discussion boards, surveys and regular updates I will provide multiple ways of making this process as engaging, frictionless and effective as possible.
What you can expect during development
A constant stream of regular game updates which fix bugs, add new features and polish the game. (BossConstructor got over 150 patches in the two years of its Early Access phase.)
Monthly progress report videos in which I present, what I've been working on lately.
Discussion boards / forums in which you can discuss the game and share your ideas.
An in-game bug reporting tool which allows you to report errors with very little effort.
Surveys in which you can vote on features, the development priorities and more.
My Background
Mirko Seithe
I am a 36 year old indie game developer living in Bonn, Germany. I have a professional background in computer science and made a Dr. in economics. For the last ~10 years I've been developing indie games in my free time. My first published game was BossConstructor, a 2D simulation / action game in which you build your own spaceship and fly it through alien space. BossConstructor entered Early Access in 2014 and was successfully released in late 2016. Since then I've been working on Kubifaktorium.
I have grown up playing and loving complex strategy and simulation games like Civilization, Battle Isle, The Settlers and Transport Tycoon. More recently I have enjoyed hundreds of hours of Factorio, Gnomoria, Prison Architect and Into the Breach. What these games have in common is that they enable their players to build and watch complex and interesting systems, which have always fascinated me. It's a human thing I guess. :)
Other contributors
Whenever possible and feasible I use freelancers to share the workload and improve the quality of the game. When developing BossConstructor, I've used freelancers to contribute graphics, writing, translation services, marketing and more. So even though I do most of the work, at the end of the day many people rightfully earn their place on the credits page.
Rewards
5€ or more: Name an animal or a monster in the game!
Name an animal or a monster in the game!¹
You can choose the type of animal / monster you want to name. The name you choose will then be added to a pool of names for that animal / monster type.
When an animal or monster is spawned in the game, its name is randomly drawn from this pool.
The name should fit the theme and style of the game as well as the animal / monster type you choose.
¹: Names will be reviewed before they are added to the game. I reserve the right to refuse name submissions which are offensive or otherwise inappropriate.

15€ or more: Get the game & your name in the credits!
You will receive a Steam code for the game when it enters Early Access on Steam. This includes all future updates / patches of the game.
You will receive a Steam code for Kubifaktorium after the campaign ends.
The code can be redeemed (i.e. added to your Steam account) immediately. You can play the game once it enters Early Access in early 2019. 
You will automatically receive all future updates and patches for the game.
The game will be released for Windows, Mac and Linux.
If you happen to experience problems running the game on your system, I offer a money-back-guarantee.
Your name will (optionally) appear in the thank you section of the game's credits screen.
This tier does not include access to the closed alpha stage.

25€ or more: Access to the closed alpha!
In addition to the Steam code, you get access to the closed alpha stage, which will begin shortly after this Kickstarter campaign ends.
In addition to the Steam key for the Early Access phase, you receive an itch.io key to play the game during the closed alpha stage.
The closed alpha stage will begin shortly after this campaign ends. 
60€ or more: Receive an in-game pet!
As a bonus for your awesome contribution you receive an in-game miniature pet. You can choose one of several pets which will follow your settlers around.
In every game you can create one miniature pet of your choice.
The pet is a smaller version of an existing animal or monster. Or colonist, maybe. :)
The pet moves around and might, at a later point in development, interact with your colonists.
It does not have any tangible game-play effect and is purely aesthetic.
Very cute. :)

100€ or more: Become a colonist!
Name and customize (color & style) a colonist in the game!¹ The colonist you create will show up in other players' games.
Also, I will send you a signed Kubifaktorium postcard. :)
You can choose the style of the colonist from a set of presets and choose a name. The name/style combination you choose will then be added to the colonist pool.
When a colonist is spawned in the game, his/her name/style combination is randomly drawn from this pool.
The name should fit the theme and style of the game. xxMonsterSlayer2000xx is not appropriate, for example. :)
¹: Names will be reviewed before they are added to the game. I reserve the right to refuse name submissions which are offensive or otherwise inappropriate.

250€ or more: Name an island & Get a postcard!
You get to name an island in the game!¹ Other players will be able to visit and settle on an island named after or by you.
You can choose the name of an island. The name will then be added to the island name pool.
When the world map is created, the names of the islands are randomly drawn from this pool.
The name should fit the theme and style of the game.
¹: Names will be reviewed before they are added to the game. I reserve the right to refuse name submissions which are offensive or otherwise inappropriate.

1000$ or more: In-game statue!
To honour you and your contribution, I will create an in-game statue based on your preferences¹.

The statue can be of an animal, item, person or monster of your choice.
Your name / pseudonym will be displayed when a player selects the statue.
The statues can be built by players and give positive bonus effects (e.g. increased beauty value).
Your statue is added to the statue pool.
When a player creates a statue, its look / name is randomly drawn from this pool.
The name should fit the theme and style of the game.
¹: Names will be reviewed before they are added to the game. I reserve the right to refuse name submissions which are offensive or otherwise inappropriate.

3500€: Your personal Game Jam Weekend!
You have a great game idea you always wanted to turn into reality? Awesome! I can help you realise your game while you help me realise mine. :)
I invite you (and optionally a friend) to visit for a three-day game jam weekend where we turn your idea into a small working prototype.
Before the weekend we 'meet' via video chat to discuss your game idea and decide on a date for the game jam weekend.
In the course of the game jam weekend we develop a small but working prototype based on your idea in Unity/C#. You might be surprised at what one can accomplish in 3 days! :)
All the rights to your idea and the prototype we develop belong to you. Feel free to continue working on or even publishing it at some point.
You will likely get the most value out of the weekend if you have some prior experience in working with Unity/C#.
The place for the game jam is in my office here in Bonn, Germany. Travel expenses and accommodation are not included.

Stretch Goals
Stretch goals are additional game features which will be added when the total funding amount crosses a threshold.
Trade caravans will occasionally visit your island, allowing you to trade your surplus goods for something nice. 
I will add a few more weather effects like storms, droughts and snow to the different biomes.
When the stretch goal of 25.000€ is reached, I will add a 5th biome. This includes a new tileset and a few biome specific animals or enemies. 
More stretch goals will be added as the campaign proceeds. There are many cool things on my list which I'll announce when the funding goal is reached.


Frequent Asked Questions
So, is the game playable?
The colony building and basic production are quite playable at this point. Features like automation, transport systems, other biomes etc. are still in development and can currently only be accessed via the cheat menu. Until the closed alpha begins in September, I will focus on improving accessibility and making the closed alpha launch as smooth as possible.
What can I expect during the closed alpha?
I pride myself in being very consistent in my development process. In effect, you can expect about 2-3 game patches per week in the beginning (when there are a lot of issues to fix) and about 1-2 per week later on. I will produce progress report videos to showcase new features and keep you up-to-date on the game's progress. If you are interested, I also invite you to participate by report bugs, discussing the game or voting in polls.
How will I get the game?
You will get a Steam key to activate the game when it comes to Early Access. Steam can be downloaded for free and is available on all major operating systems. I use Steam because it is the most popular platform and allows me to manage and distribute new game patches with relatively little effort.
Why are you using itch.io for the closed alpha?
Valve/Steam are restrictive when it comes to delivering content before it is for sale on their store. Itch.io is more flexible in this regard.
Will there be a DRM-free version?
Steam by itself is just a distribution platform, not DRM. I'm not going to use DRM systems like Denuvo and such.
Will there be an alternative to Steam?
Yes, as an alternative to Steam I will provide keys for itch.io. You will be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
Do I need a powerful PC to play the game?
Currently the game runs at a solid 60fps on max settings/full HD on my mid-tier laptop. You will not need a very powerful machine to run the game and can fine tune the graphics if you need to speed it up.
PLAY

What engine / tools are you using?
The game is being developed in Unity, currently 2018.2.0.f1. The voxel models are made in MagicaVoxel. Most graphics are done in Krita. Git is used for version control and zim for documentation. I am primarily using Arch-Linux for developing the game.
But... isn't Unity laggy?
In my experience it is not. Unity is a very beginner-friendly environment and attracts many beginner-level developers, who make poorly optimized games. When used properly, Unity can be very fast. Games like Cities: Skylines are powered by Unity and hardly known to be laggy. In addition, the Entity Component System will be released soon, which might work really well for games with many distributed systems like Kubifaktorium.
Are you sure it will run on Linux / MacOS?
Actually, I am developing largely on Linux, so yeah. :) I test on both on Linux and Windows regularly. MacOS should also work, as it is a standard build target for Unity, but I have no working Mac to test it at the moment.
Will it be released for Android / IPhone / Consoles?
Technically it would probably not be very hard to do. However, making the game fun to play on phones or consoles would require a lot of redesign. Playing a game on a smartphone while waiting for a train is very different from chilling in front of a computer, so an experience which works in one scenario might not be so fun on the other. In summary, it is not planned at this point. If ports for other platforms come, they will happen at the end or after the development of the PC / Mac / Linux versions.
Why do you have expenses for programming etc. when you work on the game (mostly) by yourself?
While many other project creators treat their time as if it were free, I value and include my own time as a cost factor. Doing so is a matter of taste but I think this is the more prudent way of accounting a project.
Are you sure you can finish the game?
The current state is quite playable and everything you can see in the videos above is real gameplay footage. You can download and play a demo including the first tutorial mission on itch.io: https://kubifaktorium.itch.io/kubifaktorium
I have a clear roadmap ahead of me and I've already implemented the most-likely-to-fail parts like cross-platform-compatibility, the job and AI systems, serialization and more. In addition, I'm a pretty simple guy. I just enjoy spending my time grinding away on the game and having a good time, which results in a very smooth, steady and drama-less stream of progress. :)
How can I learn more about Kubifaktorium?
I post most of my content on Facebook (https://facebook.com/kubifaktorium) or my development blog (http://kubifaktorium.com). My videos are all on YouTube (http://youtube.com/bossconstructor).
I am a journalist / streamer / YouTuber. Can I stream the game?
Yes, you can create content based on the itch.io demo. This includes monetized content. If you create something cool, I might feature or share it. :)
How expensive will the game be outside Kickstarter?
Am I getting a good deal? The game will be around 25 USD or 25 EUR, depending on region and applicable VAT. So, for the base game tier you are getting the game for less money & you are getting your rightful place in the game's credits section. When backing at a higher level you get to play the game before it goes into Early Access, which is at least half a year later.
Should I back the project?
Sure! Thanks for asking! :) If you are unsure, please consider pledging 1 Euro in order to keep track of the game and receive updates. Also, please have a look at the demo on itch.io.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
1) The main risk for every game development project is that it cannot be completed on budget or on time. Technical problems, for example, are often hard to foresee and can easily delay development by a significant amount of time. Many development studios run out of money or energy at this point and everybody involved has a bad time.

To help you gauge this risk, please consider the following three points: First, the base game, from which all trailer footage is taken, is already working. While still being far from finished, I have already implemented the most tricky parts like the job system, navigation, the transportation system and serialization. Second, I have a successful track record of starting, making and finishing a video game with BossConstructor. I have experienced problems which surface when deploying and finishing a game and know how to solve them. Third, I have sufficient backup funding which allows me to finish the game even in the case of a significant delay. 

2) The game's design is not final in any shape or form. If a feature does not turn out to be fun, I will remove it. For me, creating a lean and fun game is more important than checking off a todo list. Therefore, I cannot guarantee that all of the roadmap features will be included in the final game. If a feature that is relevant for your decision to back the game does not make it into the game, I offer you a full money-back-guarantee. 

3) Finally, there are always accidents and life's unavoidable tragedies to keep in mind. I work on the game mostly by myself, which has pros and cons in this regard. While the risk of a development team falling apart is nonexistent, the game's development depends on me being able to work on it. 

If I were to become unable to work on Kubifaktorium for some reason, I would do everything I can to either pass the project on to another development team or to ensure that you get your funding money back.

Thank you for reading and considering. :)

campaign.story:
Intro To Garden Paws
You have inherited your grandparents farm and shop as they set off to travel the world. Work with Frank at the local construction shop to finish off the final touches and get your shop running.
Aid Frank and Mayor Wilson in building up the town. Collect resources and coin to commission new buildings, each bringing unique Upgrades, Shops, Quests and more!
To build up the town you need coins, what better way to earn those then by running a shop! Explore the islands and its caves to collect everything from flowers to poop to sell in your shop. 
No matter who you are, a farmer, an explorer, a warrior, there is more to do on these islands than you'll have time for.
Relax in this role-playing game that doesn't limit your play style. Create your perfect simulation, whether you want to spend your days farming, exploring, questing or fighting.
Let us walk you through some of the many features you will find in this game.
Start off at your grandparents farm, but don't stop there. There are many islands nearby for you to explore from the tops of waterfalls to the depths of caves.

Not only that, take a boat to new islands, but be sure to have the right gear. Stay warm in the treacherous snowy peaks with earmuffs, or protect yourself from the desert sands with goggles.
With each area that you explore there are new items to find, collect, sell and even wear. Around every corner there is a chance to find hidden treasure, so you'll want to explore every chance you get.
But don't go too far, the townsfolk will need your help as they ask you to complete quests while aiding them on rebuilding their town, especially when a natural disaster strikes.
Once the mining camp is built, ask for the help of the miners to clear up the rubble and open new mining caves. Don't worry, there won't be any spirits here, only geodes and treasure.
You don't have to go alone on this new adventure, invite up to three friends to join. From shopkeeping to taming and exploring, everything is better with friends.
As the server host you can open your home to friends that will fully be able to interact in your world. Host a public or private server to play with old friends or make new ones.

Don't want them to touch your stuff? Lock your chests and assign individual permissions as you (the host) see fit.
Found a flower or rock you think your customers will love? Open your shop between 12:00 and 18:00 and watch the money roll in. 
Upgrade your shop from a small single table stand to a large extravagant showstopper. Personalize your shop with mannequins to show off your accessories and hats for sale. Or hang paintings on the walls to allure customers into paying more. 

Run your shop your way.
The land is not without its terrors. There is a local mine that has been boarded up since the townsfolk have heard tales of an evil necromancer raising the dead. With your help the townsfolk have a chance to put these once peaceful creatures back to their resting place.
Explore dungeons that seem to change every time you visit with new corridors and rooms to explore. There are many levels to the dungeon and the deeper you go the more perilous your journey but the more rewards you can find.
These dungeons will be the only place to find ancient artifacts to sell in your shop for profit or donate to the museum for fame.
Tired of selling boring sticks and stones? Use your crafting skills to create works of art fit for a king. Make sure to upgrade your tools and equipment to unlock new recipes and blueprints.

Use wood and stone to create anything from from boxes, tables and chairs to mannequins, walls, and boats. Unlock these expert level blueprints by improving your skill over time.

The crafting doesn't limit you there, craft 250+ items to either sell in your shop, use for quests or place around your home. 

There are many crafting stations to work from including; a cooking station, carpenters table, alchemy station, and more. The more you use a station and enhance that skill the more you will unlock new recipes for your profession and earn more coin along the way.
Dig up your seeds with flowers and vegetables in the wild or talk to Sammy the Seed Seller to purchase new seeds. Use your hoe to till the soil so it's soft enough to plant a seed.
Once planted, make sure to water it every day until your plant is fully grown. After a couple of days, reap your rewards, and harvest the flowers and veggies to sell in your shop or craft into new items.
There is water everywhere! So it's no surprise that the villagers on these islands like to fish. Whether it's dawn or dusk there is a large variety of fish to catch off the shores or in the lakes. Use different bait to have a higher chance of catching rare fish.
Learn how to catch your first fish from a local that gives you his trusty fishing rod. With your rod and bait in hand, relax and lose track of time while fishing on the coast of these beautiful islands.
 What farm is complete without animals? From Chicks to Pigs and Hippos there are many lovable creatures for you to befriend, tame and raise on your land.
Talk to Frank about building your first Chicken Coop. Once it's built, with the help of the locals, learn how to raise Chicks to Chickens. 
From here use and expand your skills to tame any animal you see across the islands. Learn how to befriend the animals with their favorite foods, from a carrot to a horse and honey to a bear, there is a unique strategy to taming any creature.
Once an animal is your companion, explore the world together, some animals will even help you find treasure, carry items and some are even mountable. Reach new heights and explore new areas with your animal pals.
Choose between a bear, bunny, fox or a cat, (with more characters to come), and personalize each one to fit your unique style through skins, accessories, unique gliders and more. Unlock new character items through questing, treasure hunting, dungeon diving and crafting.
Beautify your farm and shop by placing decorations and furniture to show off to your friends. Keep on the lookout for items with magical properties that can enhance your strength, stamina and more.
Due to popular demand, we've added add-ons! 
To add the items listed above, simply pledge to the tier you would like and add the price to your pledge. You may purchase more than 1 additional copy, you may also mix and match.
If you have already pledged then click "Manage Your Pledge" (or here) and then in "Change your pledge" and add the corresponding amount to your pledge without changing your tier.
When the Kickstarter is done, we will contact you and verify which copies you would like (Switch or Steam).
Bitten Toast Games is a game studio based in British Columbia, Canada. As a studio we've been making games for the past 3 years with titles like "What The Box?" released recently on the Xbox One and "Rocket Fist"  which was released last year on the Nintendo Switch.
Our team members are:
Daniel Snd: Lead Programmer / Technical Artist.
Kristina Vandale: Game and Level Developer.
Thiago Adamo: Music and Sound Design.
Why Kickstarter?
The game started as something my partner and I wanted to play, but it grew into so much more as we started to share it with other people.
Even in its early stages without optimization it resonated really well with our friends. That's when we decided to focus on this game and open it up to a larger community.
We're hoping to have the support of a community of players to give feedback and help this game reach its full potential. While Kickstarter will help on the financial side, the community aspect is even more important to us.
Our past games included the community but were limited by our reach, we only had a small social media platform stretching across twitter, twitch and facebook. With the help of kickstarter we hope to involve the community more in the development of garden paws.
We are maintaining a Discord server and love to hear any and all feedback from the community.
Current State
We began developing this game mid-2018 and has been in a playable state for a little while now. (Some twitch and youtube videos are up with the help of our closed alpha testers.)
With our current build we are ready to receive more players for a closed alpha once Kickstarter concludes.
The game currently has 20+ hours of questing, but the gameplay itself is endless. We plan on adding many more quests in the future but this isn't the focus of the game.
We want to create a game that you can play with your friends and participate in mini-games or explore the world and fight PVE battles. While there will be an extensive quest-line in the final game. This is only one of our many features of Garden Paws.
About the Developers  
We started the creation of Garden Paws because we love this genre and wanted to make something we could play together online. Combining multiple game elements we love, we came up with Garden Paws. A game where you run your shop, explore beautiful islands, dive into dungeons to fight evil spirits, and all of this will be multiplayer. 
We really enjoy bringing Garden Paws and its world to life and definitely won't stop until it has every feature we want to play in the game. 
We have decided to launch the game as an early access release that we can keep working on because there is so much that we want to add. It's current state has 20+ hours of questing and endless game play, but we plan on having even more quests and features. 
With the help and support of the Kickstarter community we know we can make a great game together.
Budget Breakdown
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're 100% focused on Garden Paws, we not only want to create this game for ourselves but for the community that has shown so much excitement about the project.https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/bittentoast/garden-paws-relaxing-multiplayer-rpg-simulation/edit?ref=pbuild_dashboard#the-story

While this is our first Kickstarter we have absolutely no hesitations in releasing this game. We have released 5 games in the past and we have no doubt we will be able to release this game as well. While this is more than we usually take on we already have a full playable game with 20+ hours of content that we can send out but we want to make the game more complete before releasing.

With this being a game we have never created before, our biggest challenge is creating something that is tailored towards the community. While we have individually played hundreds of hours of this style of game it is always beneficial hearing what the players want.

We hope Kickstarter will open us up to this audience.
