updates.update_userinfo: Human Character, More Saves, New Items and more!
updates.update_content:
We are introducing a new character, The Human as a free Garden Paws DLC. We have decided to introduce the character in this way so that if anyone doesn't want human character in their game they can simply not download the DLC.
The character DLC is also bringing in several new hair styles that can be used on any character. These hair styles can by dyed and can be placed in the existing hair equipment slot or the second hair equipment slot that has been added with this update.

updates.update_userinfo: New Map, Steam Workshop and Switch Update
updates.update_content:
The dev team; Dan, Kristina and Thiago, want to give a HUGE Thank You to everyone that has been supporting us making our dream game over the past little while. Your steam reviews, twitch streams,  tweets, feedback, and really everything is so helpful at making Garden Paws as good as it can be. Spreading the word about Garden Paws brings in more people and let's us continue to work on it, adding new content and expanding the GP world, so we just wanted to say how grateful we are. The game wouldn't be what it is today without you. Alright, time for the important stuff.
Switch Update

updates.update_userinfo: Farm Plots, Tortoises, Breeding and more!
updates.update_content:
This next update we're excited to bring you more creatures to breed, the tortoise, farm plots and more. We have been having a great time connecting with the community through Twitch and have added Garden Paws avatars for everyone to use while streaming! Twitch integration can be activated by typing in your channel name, once you are connected you can turn on "viewers on bottom of screen". 
Your chatters will be able to interact by typing "hype", "love", "jump", "dance" and do other fun emotes while you're playing! They can even change their character by typing in the character type, (Ex. Dragon).

updates.update_userinfo: Happy Holidays! Kozita expanded! Dragons, Owls, Optimization and more!
updates.update_content:
This update is packed full of both optimization improvements and content! As we've been working on bringing the game to the Switch we had to take some time to tackle optimizing the game for a different platform, and this update for the PC makes full benefit of that, with considerable lower memory consumption and running much smoother.
Gamepad

updates.update_userinfo: Breeding, A New Horse and lots more in this Spooky Update
updates.update_content: Breeding; Cats, Chickens and Sheep!

updates.update_userinfo: Staying PAWsitive with some new items and a new mount!
updates.update_content:
Hope everyone is doing well! We've got a few new items to share with you along with a new mount! This update is relatively small compared to our past updates as we work on the Switch. We'll have big news on the Switch soon. 
Horse Sanctuary
The next sanctuary to be added to Kozita is the Horse Sanctuary and along with it a very rare horse mount that can only be obtained from completing this sanctuary. We won't post any spoiler-y photos here though in case anyone wants the surprise in game.
New items

updates.update_userinfo: Roses, Tropical Plants, Furniture and More!
updates.update_content:
For this mini update as we work on the Switch we wanted to add a new crop and some new items to collect. We have done some tweaks and bug fixes as well. Hope you enjoy!
On Kozita island, Herb has new quests that unlock 3 new shop stalls to purchase items. There is the Rose and Lavender Seed Stall, the Tropical Plants Stall and the Garden Furniture Stall.
Switch update: At this time we don't have an eta but we are working on it and have had it playable on the Switch for a little bit. We're now focussed on optimizing the game so that players can build and have all the features that Garden Paws has on the PC. We're doing our best and we appreciate your patience.

updates.update_userinfo: New Island, Treasure Hunting, and German Translations!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone, since the last large update for Garden Paws we have been taking some time to focus on optimization for the Switch launch. We are working very hard and every day are getting closer to porting onto the Switch. The Switch has taken us longer than we initially planned mainly due to how large and how much content Garden Paws has compared to our initial plans. 
A few months ago we talked with our team and the community to see if we wanted to launch to the Switch "as is" but there was an overwhelming response from the community that people would rather wait for all the content the PC gamers would have. Porting such a large "heavy" game to the Switch requires lots of optimization which we have been focusing on. We have gotten the game but it requires more as everything the player builds adds to the process and memory. We are trying our best to find ways around this without limiting the game play or graphics quality. We hope to have more to share with you and apologize for the delay.

updates.update_userinfo: Bulk Board, The Hedgehog, Dungeon, New Items and Bug Fixes
updates.update_content:
This update includes quite a few bug fixes, performance boosts, a new creature, 20+ quests and some huge dungeon improvements. We applied quite a few changes that we heard from the community in Discord or on Steam Discussions including a chance to gather a Plant Fiber Seed and grow your own fern, increasing habitat capacities and other quality of life features.
We really appreciate everyone's input and wish we could add all these epic ideas to Garden Paws, unfortunately with it being just the two of us working on features we're not able to add everything. With that we want to do another announcement that is almost ready to go live, we just need a few more mods made for testing it before we can launch to the public. If you're interested in becoming a mod creator please join our Discord for beta access.

updates.update_userinfo: 100 Dungeon Levels, Castle, Skunk, Fishing 2.0 and more!
updates.update_content:
Version 1.3.8 is now live! This update is packed full of content! We're really excited about this update we've added the 100 floors of the dungeon and will continue to work on it for future updates. We have added new tools, furniture sets, a new creature and more! 
We made a small video showcasing this update. If you like the video update let us know and don't forget to share it with your friends. :) We have posted this video on Twitter and Facebook as well.

campaign.story:
Odie is an aging corgi with a flare for the dramatic narrative. In issue #1, we saw him lost far from home. Armed with only his bravery and his cunning, he faced challenges familiar to anyone who has ever read through Homer’s Odyssey.

In issue #2, Odie has been reunited with the family that he loves, and is embarking on their annual lake-side vacation. Unfortunately for Odie, that also means Kujo, his newly adopted brother, will be coming along for the ride. Odie will have to cope with his jealousy over being forced to share the family with another dog and work together with some strange new friends in order to track down a legendary prey.
Essentially, Odie is a foil for re-imagining classic literature in a new and fun light! This first story of Issue #2 will deal with Odie's relationship to Kujo while mirroring the tale of Herman Melville's Moby Dick. As a bonus, there's a short story highlighting Odie's deteriorating mind while homaging Kafka's Metamorphosis.
The comic is twenty-four full color pages by our talented artists, and features a thank-you page for all of the Kickstarter contributors in the back.
Digital and physical editions of Odie #1 and Odie #2 will be available as part of this campaign. These comics are staple-bound, and printed in a gorgeous, high-quality gloss by Ka-Blam.
In addition to the standard cover, this comic is also available in a limited edition variant cover printed on blue paper, with a foundation of white ink used to create a contrast between glossy and matte elements. This cover will be exclusive to the Kickstarter campaign, so don't miss your chance to snag one!
Just like last time, Elli will be taking requests for the sketch cover edition of the comic! If you select this reward tier, be sure to let us know what sort of illustration you'd like. Here are a few of the covers that she did for Odie #1:
If you didn't have the chance to get one of our 5" x7" Odie sticker sheets in the last Kickstarter, they're back, featuring four glossy indoor stickers of everyone's favorite pup. In addition to that, we'll have four unique 1" button designs available in a set!
Elli and Mikael have whipped up a fantastic 11"x17" art print of the entire cast of issue #2, decked out in some pirate garb.
And last but not least, if you want to see yourself thrust into this world and drawn by our wonderful artists, you can make a cameo! You, or a character that you own, will be seen lounging on the shoreline in at least one panel. Of course, we do ask that you be reasonable with the appearance of yourself or your character, and we retain the right to refuse things that wouldn't fit within the setting. However, as long as you don't ask us to make you a Deceptacon, everything should be fine.
Every project needs stretch goals! We have a few extra rewards up our sleeves if you can help us reach these numbers. Find out more about each as funding progresses.
Author/Creator: Aaron Sullivan
Comic book author and senior contributor for ComicCrusaders living in Mississippi, USA. Author of Odie #1, and anthology stories for Comichaus (The Cave, Hands) and Octal (Fit for a King).

Primary Artist: Elli Puukangas
 Freelance Illustrator from Finland, living in the UK. Creator of the webcomic Tistow. 
Primary Colorist: Mikael Hankonen
Self-taught illustrator and gaming graphic artist. Creator of the webcomic Year In Hereafter.
Backup Story Artist: Chandra Free
Published Comic Creator, Artist & Writer. Creator of The God Machine
 Funding
 The funding goal of this Kickstarter campaign is set at $5,000. If we reach that it will cover the entirety of the creation of the comic book. It will not fully cover the production or design of the rewards, but I am willing to cover that cost myself in order to make this comic a reality!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With Odie #1, we saw some significant delays due to personal struggles with members of the team, and inaccurate budgeting on my part. With that comic, we all learned a lot, and have taken steps to stay ahead of the proverbial curve with deadlines and dollar amounts. 

Odie #1 was the first comic that I have personally ever Kickstarted, and I'm going into the second issue with a better understanding of the process at every level. 

Elli, Mikael, and Chandra are all professionals that can be counted on to finish this book in a timely manner.

Like last time, Ka-Blam will also be aiding in reward fulfillment, alleviating some of the stress on the team.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: New Series from Small Scale Studios
updates.update_content:
Small Scale Studios has an new comic project on Kickstarter!
Some of you may have already seen, but after a brief hiatus from writing, I've come back to launch a new comic called NIL. Nil is the story of the lone survivor of a decimated tribal nation being forced to integrate into western society with his dinosaur companion. It's about grief, anger, self-acceptance, and... I mean, dinosaurs. I wanted to write a story with some cool dinosaurs.

updates.update_userinfo: Okay, Let's Try This Again - Update #29
updates.update_content:
Okay, so, let's try this one more time. 
All backers, aside from a few that I've contacted today, should now have received their rewards or a confirmation that they're en route. 
We can all relax now. We did it this time. I think. I'm pretty sure. I'm hoping. Fingers crossed.

updates.update_userinfo: A Light in the Tunnel - Update #28
updates.update_content:
All replacement merch has been purchased.
The printers already have the buttons, and the stickers are on their way to them. Everything should be in hand by the end of the week after the loss of the first merchandise batch in transit.

All domestic backers who received only comics should have their rewards by now. 
If you have not, please let me know. All international backers should also be receiving their comics but I'm not sure if they've all made it yet. 
However, if you ordered more than just comics, including the stickers or the buttons, you have not yet received your reward. That is because the package containing the stickers and buttons was apparently lost in transit. I was informed by the printer/distributor over the holidays. We're working together to make things right and get new orders in as quickly as possible.

Issues of Odie are being shipped as we speak. 
After some technical difficulties communicating with the printer/distributors, I've gotten confirmation that many of the Odie backer rewards have already been sent out. You should be receiving email confirmations of shipping any day now if you haven't already. The sketch covers should be the last wave to be sent out, but will still make it to most backers before the holidays.

It's been a long time coming, guys and gals. I apologize profusely for the delays that we've had but they're here. 
They're finally here.
The comics have arrived with Chandra!
Mikael has received and signed the comic covers!

Just touching base!
I know I haven't posted in a bit, but there hasn't been much to update you all on. Elli finished the sketch covers and shipped the package out, but it's taking it a while to get back out of the UK. I will keep you up to date and be sure to let you know when things have changed! 
Thank you for your patience,
After a rough couple of weeks, we're back on track!

campaign.story:
Levi’s. Design Within Reach. Swatch. The New York Times. Williams-Sonoma. SFMOMA. Stanford University. Herman Miller. Nordstrom.
Look closely at some of the world’s most respected brands, and you’ll see the hand and vision of Jennifer Morla, a multidisciplinary designer known for her ability to inform and surprise via extraordinary print, branding, packaging, web, and retail store design. An AIGA Medalist and recipient of the Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian National Design Award, Morla is internationally celebrated for solutions that are cerebral yet spirited, eclectic yet tight, and for a sharp approach to storytelling that results in narratives—and designs—with real staying power.
For its second publication, Letterform Archive is thrilled to present Morla : Design. A dynamic and essential monograph that spans Jennifer Morla's 40-year career, this book offers a glimpse into her creative process and personal design philosophy, and shares the backstory behind more than 150 worthy projects, including fine art as well as client work.
Gathered in an innovative print package that is nothing short of astounding—featuring fluorescent and metallic inks throughout, a vegan leather case, two neon bookmark ribbons and colored page edging, two paper stocks (one matt art and one vellum with white ink), and a choice of an edition with a debossed cover or one with an embossed vacuum-form cover and a clamshell box—Morla : Design is an art object in its own right. And with your backing, we can make it a reality.
The Book
A tome of award-winning graphics, Morla : Design celebrates the design thinking of one of our brightest contemporary creatives. With a preface by Paula Scher and foreword by Erik Spiekermann, the book is a lively, cleverly paced collection of branding projects, stories, advice, and typographic wisdom, resulting in an inspirational reference guide that belongs in the personal collection of anyone who loves good design.
158 projects in branding, print, animation, packaging, furniture, and retail store design—plus examples of her fine art—give a generous overview of Morla's career.
16 Designisms printed in white ink on vellum punctuate the book, sharing Morla's guiding principles and providing teachable moments.
20 personal stories reveal the experiences, artists, and design influencers that helped shape Morla's unique perspective, as well as her thoughts on the differences between design and fine art, the value of the quick sketch, how she learned to embrace happy accidents, the importance of diversity in advertising, and much more. (You'll also hear all about that one time she commissioned work from Andy Warhol.)
26 features on type close the book, offering a graphic display of Morla’s favorite typefaces—and her thoughts on why they get it done every time.
The Cover
Backers of Morla : Design have a choice between two distinct yet cleverly connected cover treatments: an embossed vacuum-form or a debossed vegan leather cover, both featuring the flip side of the same design. Titled "Mitosis," the cover pattern emulates the biological division of a single egg into two daughter cells—an homage to Morla's two daughters, to whom the book is dedicated.
For the deluxe edition, Morla experimented with this pattern in three dimensions using vacuum-formed polycarbonate, raising its system of interlocking dots to 2/5 inch in height to create a sophisticated yet otherworldly effect. 
Together, the two covers present an optical treat, as their surfaces can trick the eye and appear to invert.
Specifications 
Hardcover 
10 by 10 by 2 1/4 inches
Printed in 8 colors throughout: 
CMYK with stochastic screening + 3 fluorescent inks + 1 metallic ink
432 total pages (400 matt art + 32 vellum)
2 fluorescent bookmark ribbons 
Fluorescent page edging
The regular edition features a debossed case wrapped in soft, sophisticated vegan leather. 
The deluxe edition features an innovative vacuum-formed front cover fit over a vegan leather case, all protected by a debossed clamshell box. 
Backstory 
As a nonprofit center for inspiration, education, and community, Letterform Archive is proud to announce the donation of more than 100 books, posters, and branding pieces designed by Jennifer Morla. Housed in our collection of 40,000+ graphic design and typography samples gathered across the history of written language, Morla’s work makes for a wholly modern and exhilarating addition to our library.
Morla : Design is a commemoration of this generous gift. It is the followup to our wildly successful first book, W. A. Dwiggins: A Life in Design, which contributions from our community brought to life in November 2017.
Imaged with raking light and a 100-megapixel Phase One camera in our on-site photography studio, the original artwork in Morla : Design is of the highest possible reproduction quality. Thanks to stochastic printing, the book's images will come across with near continuous tone and a greater range of color than that produced by conventional printing methods.
While Jennifer Morla and Letterform Archive have already heavily invested in the development of Morla : Design, your support will help us cover printing and distribution costs. 
Praise 
From Paula Scher's preface: “There are designers who identify the culture of the period and adapt it to their own personal vision. They are the ones who transcend time but remain of the moment. There is no better example of this than Jennifer Morla, which this book clearly demonstrates.”
From Erik Spiekermann's foreword: “Great ideas beautifully visualized: that is Jennifer’s work in a nutshell. Her work displays an intellectual curiosity expressed in sensual, exciting type and images.”
From Rob Forbes, founder of Design Within Reach: "I surmise that most designer monographs end up as anonymous bookshelf space holders. Maybe the lucky ones become reference books in studios and libraries. But Jennifer Morla’s book will also serve as a formidable coffee table book. It is artful, elegant, provocative, lively, smart: quintessentially modern. You can open it up randomly to any page and find some compelling visual narrative or message. Morla’s work is impossible to reduce to a style or formula as it encompasses numerous media and industries. Both fashionable and classic, this book will have a great shelf life, wherever it ends up."
From Tiffany Shlain, Emmy-nominated filmmaker and founder of the Webby Awards: "Jennifer Morla's creativity is bold and brilliant. Seeing the body of her work (so far) presented in such a stunning book is truly a gift to the senses."
Additional Rewards
A reusable tote lets you carry a bit of Morla : Design around wherever you go. This lightweight and ecofriendly bag from popular retailer Baggu features Morla’s “Mitosis” pattern in neon green and slate blue. It folds up from 25 1/2 by 15 1/2 inches at full size into a 5-by-5-inch pouch. It’s durable, too, holding up to 50 pounds.
A 100-percent silk scarf makes for a vivid yet delicate memento of this beautiful book. A 30-by-30-inch square with a rolled edge, it features a neon green and slate blue version of Morla’s “Mitosis” design.
A pair of pick-your-own ABC posters will look lovely as a monogrammed set in any room. Each 24-by-16-inch giclée poster is printed on acid-free matt archival paper with archival inks and signed and numbered by the artist. See the full set here. (If you choose this premium, you'll receive a survey to confirm your poster selection at the close of the campaign.)
Your choice of two posters: Morla's design for beloved San Francisco manufacturer Public Bikes, or her vivid yet sophisticated print for the Mexican Museum. Both 36-by-24-inch giclée posters are printed on acid-free matt archival paper with archival inks, and are signed and numbered by the artist. (If you choose this premium, you'll receive a survey to confirm your poster selection at the close of the campaign.)
Project Credits
Jennifer Morla (author and designer) established Morla Design as a multidisciplinary design firm encompassing identity, packaging, print, animation, retail, and trade environments when she was just 28 years old. With more than 300 awards of excellence, she has been recognized by virtually every organization in the field of visual communication. She is the recipient of design’s most honored accolades: The Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian National Design Award and the AIGA Medal. Her work has been published extensively—most notably in Meggs’ History of Graphic Design—and has been acquired for the permanent collections of the MOMA, the SFMOMA, the Smithsonian Museum of American Art, the Denver Art Museum, and the Library of Congress. Morla is an elected member of Zurich-based Alliance Graphique Internationale (AGI), and she has served on the National Board of AIGA and acted as chair of SFMOMA’s Architecture and Design Forum. She taught senior-level design for more than 20 years at California College of the Arts.
Paula Scher (preface contributor) has been a partner in the New York office of Pentagram since 1991. She began her career as an art director in the 1970s, and her wide-ranging approach to typography quickly became highly influential. Paula is featured in “Abstract: The Art of Design,” the Netflix documentary series about leading figures in design and architecture. 
Erik Spiekermann (foreword contributor) is an art historian, a printer, a type designer, an information architect, and an author. He founded MetaDesign in 1979 and FontShop in 1989. He was the Royal Designer for Industry Britain in 2007. He now runs p98a, an experimental letterpress workshop in Berlin.
Rob Saunders (publisher) is a designer, teacher, and management consultant with a lifelong interest in the letter arts. Rob taught at the Museum School in Boston, then published graphic design and children’s books through the Alphabet Press, Picture Book Studio, and Rabbit Ears Books imprints. After 40 years of collecting graphic design and lettering, he founded Letterform Archive to make the collection available to students, designers, and admirers of the letter arts.
Lucie Parker (associate publisher) has nearly 15 years’ experience crafting best-selling and award-winning books for the trade and gift markets. She specializes in producing design-driven titles, often in collaboration with museums and magazines. 
Leslie Carol Roberts (editor) is an author, a writing coach, and a narrative dynamo who helps people write and edit best-selling books on complex and varied subjects—from the environment to aesthetics. Leslie also travels the world and writes books and essays about who and what she finds, such as The Entire Earth and Sky: Views on Antarctica and Here Is Where I Walk. Her writing has been published in hundreds of essays and articles in newspapers, magazines, and journals in the United States and abroad.
Kris Johnson (director/owner k r i s f i l m s) specializes in documentary-style productions with a twist. Her clients past and present include SFMOMA, Levi Strauss & Co., Stanford Graduate School of Business, Vanderbyl Design, Design Within Reach, Adobe, Flowers Vineyards & Winery, Treasury Wine Estates, UCSF, Sequoia Capital, and SF Ballet.
Reymundo Perez (designer) and Arlene Susmilch (project manager) have worked with Jennifer Morla on Morla : Design and numerous other Morla projects, handling design production and project management.
Press Materials
For high-res images, sample spreads, and a press release, please visit here. 
Production Schedule 
Book printing will begin in October 2018; binding in November 2018.
All books and premiums will ship to backers in January 2019.

updates.update_userinfo: Morla : Design Book Signing at Modernism Gallery
updates.update_content:
Dear Morla : Design backers,
This Saturday, October 24, Jennifer Morla will be at Modernism Gallery in San Francisco for a special, socially distanced book signing from 2:00 – 5:00 PM. If you’ve been thinking about giving Morla : Design as a gift this holiday season, or if your friends have been waiting to grab their copies, now is the perfect time. And if you can’t attend the signing, we’re making signed copies available for delivery — now through Saturday only.
Those who wish to attend the signing and see Modernism’s current show, Jacques Villegle Les Boulevards de la Creation: Decollages from 1952 to 2006, can reserve their timed admission by placing a preorder by this Thursday .

updates.update_userinfo: An Online Salon with Jennifer Morla
updates.update_content: You lent your support, now come toast with us! This Wednesday, October 23, from 6:30pm–8:30pm we will commemorate the publication of Morla : Design at Letterform Archive. This project has been a team effort made possible by your involvement, it seems only right to celebrate the work together. We invite you to join us for an evening of design banter between two of the profession’s luminaries: Michael Vanderbyl and the book’s author and designer, Jennifer Morla. You can get your book signed at the event, and additional copies will be available for purchase. Snacks and libations will be served. Register on Eventbrite to reserve your spot at the party.

campaign.story:
Learning to Love Your Body is an empowering guide for girls to support the development of positive body image. In this book, girls are encouraged to view their body as an incredible instrument that allows them to do, see and feel. The concept of self-love is introduced and practical self-care tips are included to build resilience and emotional intelligence.
This book was written for every girl, regardless of whether or not they are exhibiting signs of negative body image. We are living in an incredibly visual world and unfortunately it’s becoming increasingly hard for girls to escape internalising the pressure of perfection. Prevention is key: Every girl deserves to be taught about self-love and self-acceptance.
Learning to Love Your Body encourages girls to do more and see more through empowering illustrations that show girls exploring, creating and embracing who they are.
The powerful illustrations by Carol Rossetti show truly diverse characters celebrating their different bodies. So-called ‘imperfections’ (such as stretch marks, pimples and cellulite) are shown in order to normalise characteristics which, though completely natural, are not usually portrayed in children’s books or popular media.
10 self-care suggestions that you can put up in your child's room to act as a visual reminder to practice self-care. Also looks cute in an adults room too!
    “Negative body image, in my opinion, is one of the greatest barriers preventing women and girls from fully engaging in life and reaching their full potential. Since discovering body positivity, I have regularly thought about what a difference it would have made if I had been exposed to these important concepts of self-love, self-care and self-acceptance as a young girl. I see Learning to Love Your Body as an exciting opportunity to deliver a valuable resource to empower girls.”
Jessica Sanders - Author & Founder
Body image is the perception that a person has of their physical self and the thoughts and feelings that result from that perception. Body image can have serious implications for people’s emotional and physical well-being, and is a crucial part of adolescent development. Research links body dissatisfaction with critical mental health problems, including eating disorders, low self-esteem and depression.
Children, Teens, Media, and Body Image Report. Common Sense Media 2015
Body positivity is accepting, respecting and loving your body as it is.
 In a recent study, 50% of five-year-old girls showed signs of aspiring to the ‘thin ideal’. It’s most common for girls to develop eating disorders between the ages of eight and 13, when their bodies are growing and changing during adolescence. Learning to Love Your Body was designed to prepare girls for these external changes before they happen and to reassure them during the process.
Learning to Love Your Body has been written so that children younger than eight should be able to navigate the book if assisted by a parent or teacher. Each of the characters in the book are shown before and after puberty. In this way a girl can see the physical changes on a range of diverse bodies and appreciate that these changes look different on everyone.
Parents should be aware of the subliminal messages reaching their children through movies, television shows and other forms media. A study of top children's movies reported that "72% associated thinness with positive character traits such as kindness, and three out of four videos equated obesity with undesirable qualities”*. Children are being sent the damaging message that thinness equals a good person and fatness a bad person. Exposure to more explicit representations of unattainable beauty will dramatically increase when a girl becomes active on social media. Girls spend on average six hours per day on social media. Girls who spend the most time on social media are five times more likely to say they feel sad or depressed almost everyday.
*Children, Teens, Media, and Body Image Report. Common Sense Media 2015
Eating disorders are serious mental illnesses; they are not a lifestyle choice or a diet gone ‘too far’. Eating disorders are estimated to affect approximately 9% of the Australian population and the rate is increasing. In the United States it is estimated that almost 1.3 million adolescent girls have anorexia, a disorder that has one of the highest suicide rates of any psychiatric condition. 
Research has shown that when a girl views her body as an instrument that performs important functions she is more likely to accept and appreciate her body. In a recent study, a direct correlation was found between women who appreciated the functionality of their bodies and positive experiences such as intuitive eating, self-compassion and believing in a broad conceptualisation of beauty, resulting in a higher overall life satisfaction.
In pursuing this project I have sought to be as resourceful as possible. I have loaned equipment and studios from my university, employed students to assist with the filming and editing, and designed the Kickstarter, website, and social media presence myself. In areas that I am not skilled however – such as book design and Illustration – I have had to employ professionals, for the quality of the design and illustrations is critical to the book’s message. The vast majority of the money raised in the Kickstarter campaign will go towards paying for this resource.”
'Re-shape’ is a social enterprise dedicated to empowering girls to love their body and themselves. When a girl feels more confident in her body she will be more assertive, perform better physically and academically, and she will say ‘yes’ to more opportunities. We intend to approach our goal through the use of a holistic approach. Our very first project, Learning to Love Your Body utilises the power of preventative education. The profits from this project will fund ‘re-shape’s’ future endeavours.

updates.update_content:
Hello Lovely Backers,
It’s been a while! I hope you are well and taking care of yourself in the lead up to the busy holiday period.
I wanted to let you know of an exciting book update. Love Your Body is being published in the United States, United Kingdom, and Canada on the 3rd of March 2020! UPDATE #2: Everyone who contributes $25 or more to the campaign can have their names listed on the thank you page of Further Over Yawnder! Wanderer Level for $250 or more. Ponderer Level for $60 or more. Wonderer Level for $25 or more. For privacy reasons, everyone will be consulted whether they want to be listed or not.
UPDATE #1: The first 50 backers of the Further Over Yawnder campaign will be entered in a draw to win a limited edition print of Ever Wondered (Where Yawns Go)? This print is exclusively available through this campaign only.
Welcome to the campaign! This is your chance to get yourself a limited 1st edition copy of the Where Yawns Go II: Further Over Yawnder picture book featuring the work of artist, Jay Dart. 
The second book in the Where Yawns Go series, Further Over Yawnder, is set to be released. This is the follow up to the acclaimed first book, Wanderer of Yawnder, self-published in 2013. The books introduce younger audiences to concepts surrounding what it’s like to be an artist, or a creator of any kind. Where do ideas come from? How does one find their own unique voice? What is it like to share your creations with the world? While the subject matter is enlightening for even the youngest of readers, there are plenty of conundrums for older audiences to ponder as well.
Each of the 300 copies in this 1st edition of Further Over Yawnder (FoY) will be signed, doodled on and numbered by the artist. There are also lots of beauty rewards to be had in this campaign including the Field Guide to Yawnder, a 2nd edition copy of Wanderer of Yawnder (the first book in the series), exclusive prints, custom commissions, original drawings, bookmarks, postcards and eBooks!
Further Over Yawnder is the follow up to part I, Wanderer of Yawnder (WoY), which I self-published in 2013 with the support of a successful online fundraising campaign. Since the limited edition of WoY sold out awhile ago, funds from this campaign will also go towards beginning to print a 2nd edition of that book here too. This series is suitable for audiences of all ages. Lots of magical, mystical fun and conundrums! 
Further Over Yawnder – cover concept (work in progress)
ABOUT THE NEW BOOK
Further Over Yawnder will be 8.25" x 8.25", full-colour, hardcover book with 32 beauty pages featuring 20 high quality reproductions of my original watercolour and graphite drawings, and a story by Jiggs, my alter ego (more on him later). The cover will be case bound on 140 gsm FSC stock and the inside pages will be printed on 115 gsm FSC paper (the sustainable stuff). The 1st edition of Further Over Yawnder will be limited to 300 copies.
This part of the saga continues to follow Jiggs as he seeks to find the mystical nature of inspiration, innovative creation, and meaningful communication. As he continues to grow his Geistwood trees to epic proportions, he seeks the help of some fellers in order to get these creations out there. Along the way, Jiggs attempts to get the attention of the giant Foremoms who have the power to take things farther and wider than he could even imagine. But when he runs into his old pal, Barry the Mannalo (who is half man, half buffalo, of course), who warns Jiggs about the arrival of Dynamite Doug, Jiggs ventures further over Yawnder and what he discovers next will blow yer mind! 
STRETCH GOALS
If I manage to raise more funds, then I will be able to include some fancy designer end pages on the inside front and inside back covers. If I really go over my goal, and the reward levels start to sell out, then I will start printing some of the 2nd edition copies of Further Over Yawnder, and make those available in this campaign — however, they won't be fancy and exclusive like the limited 1st edition.
Jay Dart at Art Toronto 2018 (photo by John Armstrong)
ABOUT THE ARTIST
I'm a drawist/author/designer from a small hamlet in the north part of Whitby, about an hour outside of Toronto, Canada. Over the past decade, I have been exhibiting locally and internationally in commercial and public art venues, with recent stops at international art fairs including Art Toronto, Papier (Montreal) and Drawing Now (Paris). While my focus is on presenting graphite, watercolour and pastel works on paper from his Yawnder series, I also create interactive, installation pieces that bring elements of my two-dimensional narrative works to the real world, like the Geistwood Stools which you can even get via this campaign (see Rewards breakdown below). This series references images of settlers forging their way on the frontiers of the wilderness, and rearranges them into a conceptually layered world that examines the nature of the creative process and its relationship with modern technologies. Bookworks allow me to present the story that has evolved throughout this body of work – each piece adds to a narrative labyrinth that I continue to travel within. 
Jiggs and Floyd – from the Field Guide to Yawnder
ABOUT JIGGS
Jiggs is my alter ego and the main character of the Where Yawns Go series. He's also the one who wrote the story for both Wanderer of Yawnder and now Further Over Yawnder — makes sense, right? All that you need to know about him can be found in these books but he also has his own website featuring some strange drawings. This past winter, director March Mercanti made a profile video on my art practice for the CBC (Canadian Broadcasting Corporation) that goes further into the relationship between Jiggs and I (see video at the top of this page).

updates.update_content:
Hello fellow wanderers (aka. fellers),
After much ado with the printer this past month, the book has finally gone to press this week!  
However, a big change had to be made. After receiving the hard bound proofs, it became apparent that the page count for two shorter books wasn't going to work for hard cover binding, despite what the printer initially told me. So I had to make the tough decision to combine the new Further Over Yawnder (FoY) book with the reprint of Wanderer of Yawnder (WoY), the first book in this series. These two stories will now be released as Volume 1 of the Where Yawns Go chronicles...

I'm happy to announce that the goal for the Where Yawns Go II: Further Over Yawnder campaign was reached late last night with about 24 hrs left (it ends at midnight tonight)! 
Thank you so much to all of those who backed my project. Life is busy and the world is kinda crazy right now, so it means a lot that you were able to take the time to support my artistic endeavour. Without you, I wouldn't be able to do the limited edition print run like I did for the first book, and Further Over Yawnder may have only existed as an eBook. And that's not where picture books belong. Perhaps one day, this series will find a place in the mainstream, but for now, I'm happy to share it with my fellers.

campaign.story:
What if you could give life to the traditional woodblocks?
PLICO is 9 woodblocks, and infinite possibilities to create routes for marbles. For kids from 7 to 777, this game provides a new dimension to the classic woodblocks game: movement!
PLICO can be played anywhere and with anything: on the edge of a table, using books, objects or stairs to add levels to the game.
PLICO_Collection of 9 pieces
Challenge yourself, share fun moments and boost your brain power!
PLICO is a true game, where players experiment through trial and error to achieve success. It is a construction game, both physical and psychological, which reveals the creativity within every player, young and old.
This educative game is an entertaining introduction to the basic laws of physics, it champions focus, precision, motor skills. It is about imagining, trying, understanding, learning, and having fun!
PLAY

 Create a community, launch production.
Our first goal is to create a community. This game must be tackled by pioneers and curious minds who will be able to share their ideas and discoveries and expand the possibilities of PLICO.
I want to make PLICO available to an audience as large as possible, this is why I’m raising 1 000€ via Quickstarter - just enough to start production.
All the images in this campaign feature prototypes, a successful crowdfunding would allow us to launch a semi-industrial, or even better, a full-scale industrial production. sky is the limit!
PLICO_One composition with Color collection
PLICO_One composition with Color collection
PLICO_One composition with Color collection
Stretch goals
From 1000 to 3000 euros, the pieces will be produced by myself in a Fablab based in France.
From 3000 to 9000 euros, the pieces will be produced by a company with high production facilities either based in France or in Portugal.
More than 9000 euros, we can imagine two solutions: reach out to an industrial production company or build our own production workshop.

PLICO_First constructions
PLAY

PLICO_Start!
Manufacturing and tolerance
The game is manufactured with precision in Europe. Each block is made out of beech wood for solidity and stability. PLICO will come with Ø14mm marbles for optimal playability. For a more challenging experience, you can also use Ø16mm marbles which will also fit the grooves.
The colored pieces are made with a hand-dipping technique in see-through inks. We are currently testing options for more durable inks, which might be of different colors, but will still be harmoniously matched together.
PLICO_Prototyping
PLICO_Tunnel
Milestones and dates 
Here are the project milestones from the beginning to the end: 
March 2018 - Start of project, design and prototypes.
April 2018 - Final prototypes and Quickstarter campaign build.
June 2018 - Launch of the Kickstarter campaign.
July 2018 - End of the campaign and sending Purchase Order to Factory.
September 2018 - Receiving products and dispatch of all the rewards.
November 2018 - Your PLICO SET in your mailbox!

PLAY

PLAY

Unlike most other reusable coffee cups currently available, Swig is made using 100% food grade silicone rubber and high temperature resistant glass. Liquid silicone rubber’s characteristics and chemical properties make it an ideal material for this design. Liquid silicone rubber parts are also chemically inert, hypoallergenic and resistant to bacteria growth. They also feature high biocompatibility, which is why this material is often used in medical applications.
Swig has been engineered to withstand extremely high temperatures, allowing it to be 100% dishwasher and microwave safe. Thanks to both its materials and intuitive user-centred design, Swig is able to carry even the hottest of hot chocolates without breaking a sweat.
We understand that everything looks better when it comes in a box, even Swig. This is why each and every Swig and Swig Mini comes gift boxed ready for retail shelves. As all rewards will be delivered gift boxed, Swig makes for an ideal gift for those hard to buy for coffee lovers.
Everyone has different tastes – in both coffee and colours. This is why Swig is available in a range of colour palets that range from modern chiec to vibrant pastels. The range of colour combinations allows you to own a Swig that is as individual as you. Both Swig and Swig Mini are available in five unique colour combinations (shown above).
As a practicing Industrial Designer, Blake has extensive experience in developing a wide range of products from concept design to manufacturing and mass production. This includes working collaboratively with a number of international manufacturers to develop products in a variety of industries from medical and mining to consumer goods and leisure products. With a portfolio that includes award winning work, Blake aims to design products that focus on how individuals interact with their everyday world.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After the success of our first Kickstarter (The Ice Bandit) we were lucky to learn first hand the potential issues and obstacles that come with creating a new project. We carefully planned the execution of this project and succesfully supplied rewards to over 200 backers, two months earlier than originally planned. The feedback proved to be extremely encouraging and was an excellent result for our first Kickstarter project.

With this said, there are inherent risks with producing any new product. As a practicing product designer, I understand this first hand. To help negate some of the issues that commonly occur with any new product, every stage has been carefully considered. As the tooling has already been produced, the largest cost has already been met. We have spent the past few months going back and forth with our trusted manufacturer, allowing us crucial development time to test the design and ensure that the final product is as we envisioned from the start. 

From tooling through to shipping, each stage of the manufacturing process has been factored into the project's budget and timeline . A detailed plan has also been created to outline all costs involved in the execution of the project.

As a fully qualified and currently practising product designer, I base my reputation on my proven ability to provide a quality product in a given timeframe. I consistently strive to expand my skills as a designer and aim to create unique and thoughtfully designed products which improve the everyday lives of those who interact with them.

updates.update_content:
Hi Swig Backers
Thanks for your patience - we have a shipping update on your orders. 
For our international orders (outside Australia) - these have now been shipped from our fulfillment centre. We will contact you individually to provide the tracking numbers. 
For our Australian orders - we have sent out a handful that were express shipped for inspection, the remainder have just been cleared through customs and will be sent via Australia post (hopefully this week). We will provide tracking numbers when they are available.

updates.update_userinfo: Production Update: Swigs are Now Shipping!
updates.update_content:
Good news Swig backers, we have now completed production and packaging of all the Kickstarter orders!  
We have sent the orders to a specialist fulfillment agency who will ship the orders around the world (we have 28 countries to deliver to!). The orders should reach them within the next two weeks, then we estimate that they will arrive at your doorstep within 20 days after that. We will provide individual tracking numbers to you when they leave the fulfillment centre. 
A reminder - if you have changed shipping address, please let us know ASAP. We need to finalise the list for the fulfillment agency within the next 7 days.

Hi Swig Backers
Thank you all for your patience, as we approach the Christmas holidays we'd like to give you a quick update to share our progress over the past couple of weeks and let you know when your Swigs will arrive!  
The good news is that after a bit of back and forth with the glass manufacturer we have fixed the quality issue that was causing some cracking in the base. We have personally inspected the first 500 production units and they are all fantastic. We have also engaged QA/QC professionals to inspect the Kickstarter order before it leaves the manufacturing facility.

Hi Swig backers, 
We thought it was about time for a production update, we have lots of exciting progress to share. Before that though, just a final reminder, if you haven't filled in your survey yet, we absolutely must get this before the start of October or we won't have anywhere to ship your Swig to! Also if you have changed your shipping address, please send through an email and we will update manually - we have already sent the survey list with the colour/size choices to start production.

We are pleased to announce that we will be offering mix and match colours for all our Kickstarter backers! Now you can find the perfect colour combination for your Swig with a choice from five mouthpiece colours, five lid colours, and five sleeve colours. 
Although we fell just short of the stretch goal, we wanted to thank and reward our Kickstarter backers for supporting us from the beginning. Thank you all for your patience over the past couple of weeks while we sorted out the logistics with our manufacturing and fulfillment facilities.

updates.update_userinfo: Good news Swig backers - we're offering mix and match colours! Choose yours now!
updates.update_content:
Our Kickstarter campaign has finally come to an end - thank you for all your support! We were overwhelmed by the amount of interest our campaign received. We have spent a long time in design and development and are super excited to finally bring Swig to life!
We received some great feedback during the campaign and are now in the process of adjusting the mouthpiece tooling to feature the Swig logo (our first stretch goal). We fell just short of our second stretch goal of mix and match colours but will have another discussion with our logistics company and factory to see if we can sort something out.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you Swig backers - we're going into production!
updates.update_content:
With a little under three days left on the campaign, we wanted to send out a huge thanks to everyone who has backed us to date. We’ve had an amazing run so far and a really great boost in the past week. We are now closing in on our second stretch goal - (mix and match colours) which we know many of you have been eagerly looking forward to.
Though we are not there yet we are quietly confident that we can reach this second stretch goal. (fingers crossed). For when we do hit the second stretch goal, we have put together a graphic to help you choose your perfect Swig.

We just hit our first stretch goal - now all Swigs will be delivered with the new mouthpiece!
We received some great ideas from our backers on how to make Swig better - one of the best was a visual and tactile way to tell whether the mouthpiece was open or closed. The new mouthpiece design features an embossed Swig logo on the top surface so when it is visible you can take a swig! Take a look on our stretch goal image below - we will try post some new images towards the end of the campaign.

           The SWAYY Premus™ and Eira™ are your all-in-one hammock camping systems. What started out as a bunch of crazy ideas has now come to fruition in the form of an amazing outdoor experience. Let us SWAYY you to go anywhere and do anything, outside.
The Problem
When you put a sleeping bag in the hammock with you, the insulation compresses on your backside and you get cold.
CBS - Cold Butt Syndrome
 You don't hammock camp? Let us ask a question:
The Solution
We use "Loft" technology to hang insulation lower than your bum... No more CBS (Cold Butt Syndrome). 
Loft is the ability of insulation to trap air between the fibers (synthetic insulation) or feather dander (down). Loft allows for the trapped air pockets to be warmed up. For our synthetic insulation, this is achieved by allowing the insulation to Loft without any compression below your backside. The down insulation follows the same model, it just uses a different material.
The SWAYY Premus™ and Eira™ work using 3 main layers of material. 
The 1st holds your weight. (Up to 400lbs!)
The 2nd insulates you using "loft" so that it does not compress against your backside, in essence, the insulation drapes a little lower than the hammock-body fabric (load-bearing layer). 
The 3rd layer is a shell that breaks the wind.
Thus we give you: 
The Premus™ is constructed using four parts.
The first is the weight bearing layer, or hammock body, is constructed using a 1.6oz per square yard, 40 Denier, nylon fabric with a 6-way ripstop to increase strength and durability. 
 The second is the insulation layer. This layer consists of two layers of Primaloft Silver 3.0oz insulation to keep opulent warmth. Each insulation layer is cut, sewn, darted and pleated in a specific way to create three specific air gaps under your backside that won't compress.
The third is the shell layer. This wind breaking layer is made of a .9oz per square yard, 15 Denier, nylon fabric that is designed to be lightweight and breathable enough to prevent moisture build-up.
The fourth and final piece is the full-length zipper. When zipped up, this allows for total warmth for the chilly nice. When unzipped, this allows for a steady warmth under your bum but keeps it cool enough for summer camping. The zipper is a #8 zipper that is strong, durable, and lightweight.
U.S. Provisional Patent App. No. 62/595,254

The Premus™ Suspension is constructed using 3 main parts: The carabiners, CD101 aluminum alloy cinch buckles, and Poly/Dyneema webbing. 
The carabiners are made of high grade A6061 cold-forged aluminum alloy. Each biner weights 25.7g. The closed gate strength is 10kN and the open strength is 3kN.
The CD101 cinch buckles are crafted for easy tensile adjustability of the hammock and are made using an aluminum alloy for the perfect balance of strength and weight.
The high-tensile strength webbing is made from a polyester and Dyneema blend. This keeps the weight and wearability low and the strength high. Our webbing is 1" wide and is 4.9g per foot.

The second is the insulation layer. This layer consists of 20 tubular baffles that hold 800FP DownTek storm treated goose down. Each baffle is filled with precisely 1.25oz of down.

 The Eira™ can be used with or without the ridgeline or rain-fly.
SWAYY Eira™
The Eira™ rain-fly is constructed with 4 main parts: The ridgeline (not attached to the rain-fly), the rain-fly itself, and the rain-fly quick deploy sock (above). Inside each of the four corner hems of the rain-fly, you will find a nail stake connected to the rain-fly by shock cord.
At 2.8 grams per foot, the ridgeline is made of 1/2" high-tensile strength polyester that yields low stretch and 500lbs of breaking strength.
The rain-fly is made of 2.7oz Wide Sil Nylon. It is a low stretch fabric with a ripstop grid. It has at least 1500 mm of head pressure. This fabric is a lightweight and waterproof.
The quick deploy sock cover is made of a 1.6oz 6-way ripstop nylon designed for ease of access to shelter when the storms come rolling in. When the sun comes out, simply place the four titanium nail stakes in their respective channels and pull the sock back to encase your shelter.
The 6" and 2.8g ultralight titanium nail stakes can be driven into hard soil without getting bent or damaged.
Eira™ Suspension
The Eira™ Suspension is constructed using 3 main parts: The carabiners, the titanium cinch buckles, and the Poly/Dyneema webbing.  Each component is constructed and engineered for the extraordinary adventurer and has our guarantee.
The carabiners are made of high grade A6061 cold-forged aluminum alloy. Each biner weights 25.7g. The closed gate strength is 10kN and the open strength is 3kN. 
Each of the 11g titanium cinch buckles has been crafted for easy tensile adjustability of the hammock.
The high-tensile strength webbing is made from a polyester and Dyneema blend. This keeps the weight and wearability low and the strength high. Our webbing is 1" wide and is 4.9g per foot.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our very first Kickstarter campaign, and we have lots to learn, no doubt about it. When tackling anything new, we expect there may be challenges and setbacks, but rest assured we will never stop until you the job is completed! We will work around the clock to make sure we deliver, the whole 9 yards, and then some.

1) Generally, fabrics are the longest lead item in our supply chain and if the produced fabric does not meet our high-quality control specifications it will have to be redone. This could cause an unforeseen delay. 

2) While we do expect to have your products to you as quickly as possible, there is always a possibility that we could run into unexpected delays. If this were to happen, and it probably will no, we will keep you updated as quickly and as often as possible. 

3) If by chance we amass an unprecedented number of backers, we could experience a slight delay. However, we are confident that we can deliver! 

With partners such as Primaloft® and DownTek®, we expect to carry forward in providing you with the highest of quality camping gear. 

We are dependent on several other companies staying in business and doing their job well - so with the launch of new products, we sure do appreciate your patience and support! We are founded on the principles of honesty, integrity, and giving back. We are doing everything we can to exceed your expectations, raise them, and equip you with gear that will help you encounter more!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Eye on Design | Popular Science | 99u | Abduzeedo | Cool Blind Tech | New Atlas | Graphic Design USA | Digital Trends | BBC In Touch
Meet ELIA
—
In 1829, Louis Braille published the first book introducing the braille system—and while the applications of braille have been immense, the system is designed around the outdated technologies of the 1800s.
We've created a modern, efficient alternative that's incredibly easy to learn for people who have a visual impairment. 
ELIA letters, which we call "ELIA Frames."
ELIA Frames can be read tactilely and visually.
ELIA letters—known as ELIA Frames—leverage modern printing technology and design principles to optimize each letter’s design and create easily identifiable characters. We based ELIA Frames on the standard Roman alphabet, since roughly 70% of the world’s population uses it to read and write.
Each ELIA Frame features an outer frame (circle, square, house) and interior elements that combine to form the main characteristics of standard alphabet letters. 
Most of you looking at this page likely aren't visually impaired—but maybe you know someone who is. Or, perhaps you're a designer who believes in the mission and would like to support the campaign by taking home a poster. Either way, we need your help and support to share our message.
Source: Braille Reading Rates: "Reading By Touch", By Susanna Millar, Routledge Press, 1997
Braille: the current system
Braille has been described by Fred Schroeder as “liberating a whole class of people from a condition of illiteracy and dependency, and giving them the means for self-fulfillment and enrichment.” We couldn’t agree more—it is extremely important for those who can read it. However, braille has considerable shortcomings in the 21st century:
Less than 1% of those who have a visual impairment can read braille.
Of those who lose their vision as adults (roughly 98% of the population), very few learn braille—so it is not a viable resource for the vast majority of those who have lost their vision.
Braille requires exceptional finger sensitivity and intellect, along with a lot of determination and time—it can take up to 10 months just to learn the alphabet.
ELIA: our modernized system
About 200 million people with a visual impairment could benefit from ELIA in its current design, and another 85 million could benefit from it if customized to their standard scripts.
Currently, the employment rate among individuals with visual impairment is at an estimated 43%. For those who read braille, that rate soars to 85%. ELIA can have the same benefit for the 99% who can't read braille.
ELIA Frames can be learned tactilely in as little as 3 hours—and visually in a few minutes—since the font leverages a previously established alphabet.
How to read ELIA
ELIA, Roman, and braille alphabets.
With this campaign, ELIA can enable people to gain increased independence and literacy.
ELIA Frames are scalable and beautiful!
Testimonials 
Check out this sound clip from BBC Radio 4's In Touch Podcast with Peter White!
PLAY

I’m a writer and so I work a lot with words and I’m quite interested in anything that’s going to help me read faster or read better. You mentioned when people later in life lose their sight and they lose the ability to drive or read a book, I think it will be enormously helpful for people who are older to be able to sit down and quickly begin to get information from a tactile system again...I had vision up until about the age of 12 or 13, so when I look at the O and the E and the T and the N, they’re quite recognizable. My wife is sighted and I showed it to her and within five minutes she could recognize words. 
- Adam Linn, Writer, taken from Interview with BBC Radio 4
As someone who experienced vision loss as an adult, I immediately recognized Elia as a potential tool for those in need of accessing printed information. This led me to feature their story on my podcast. Learning to tactilely recognize the alphabet in less than an hour, along with the availability of multiple font sizes, I knew this system could be especially helpful to seniors in need of labeling household items. As an advocate for people with vision loss I am all for providing people with options that best suit their individual needs. ELIA Technologies is another tool to assist people with vision loss.
—Thomas Reid, Reid My Mind Radio
I tried to learn braille three times in my life. I learned the letters easily, but words were difficult for me and sentences really slowed me down. Learning the ELIA system took me only an afternoon. It’s an easier system than braille because it uses actual fragments of the letters of the alphabet that are placed in their own individual frames. I strongly believe that it could be helpful for people who can’t read braille.
—Karen Kacen
Don’t ever quit Andrew. This alphabet is important to people who have lost their vision. It can help people remain independent. We fight to remain independent. Because if you lose your independence, then your privacy is threatened. If you lose your privacy, then your dignity is threatened.
—Elia Vallone (Andrew’s Grandmother, who inspired the creation of ELIA)
We tested ELIA with over 300 participants, and analyzed over 175,000 responses.
ELIA keyboards can revolutionize the work of the blind and the sighted, helping them type faster and more accurately.
Down the line: developing ELIA for ATMs, phones, and more.
Our design process
To design the system, we created and tested hundreds of letter shapes and combinations of letter features. We prioritized the most easy-to-feel features, incorporated them in the most frequently used letters (e.g. the letter “E” is easier to feel than the letter “K”), and then tested those letter shapes to study which were most commonly confused with others.
Working "B" Frames.
The ELIA Frames letters are designed to be understood by touch for those who have a severe visual impairment, to be read by touch and sight for those who have modest visual impairment, and to be read visually by those who have full sight.
Our process sketches creating ELIA.
The printer we hacked to create ELIA.
Printing ELIA Frames.
Our design partners
The original design for ELIA was created by our founder Andrew Chepaitis' mother. From there, Andrew, with help from graphic designer Ze Frank, developed the first frames font, and we then finalized the design of ELIA with our industrial designer, Reed DeWinter of Humanfactors Design Works.
Thanks to a collaboration with Order, we've been able to make ELIA as effective and beautiful as possible. Order is a design studio founded by Hamish Smyth and Jesse Reed, who has previously worked on communication design projects like the WalkNYC pedestrian wayfinding system, and Kickstarter’s redesign. Their team built upon our design work to leverage the essential parts with new tools, to help communicate our project in a clear, memorable, and unique way. 
Order created the Roman alphabet ELIA font using the established ELIA Frames matrix for a cohesive, effective, gorgeous new identity.
The ELIA Display font, developed by Order.
Creating the ELIA font from the ELIA Frames matrix.
Timeline
Rewards
Declaration of Independence poster—in roman alphabet and ELIA Frames, designed by Order.
Detail shot of the Declaration of Independence poster from Order.
A mock-up of the ELIA Starter Kit.
The ELIA tactile keyboard cover, so you can easily learn the system and type faster.
Our story 
Our founder Andrew was inspired to introduce ELIA after his grandmother started losing her sight from macular degeneration. A woman who could once finish the New York Times crossword puzzle, she found it difficult to learn braille—it was based on an entirely new system that she had no reference to.
That's when Andrew and his mother started thinking of a solution that built on his grandmother's skills, since her case wasn't unique—just 1% of the blind/Visually Impaired (VI) population is born without sight, with the rest losing sight later on in life. Andrew continued his mother's work through the next decade. Thirteen years later, he founded ELIA Life Technology.
Our team has since received support from the National Institute on Aging, the National Eye Institute (divisions of the National Institutes of Health), the National Institute for Standards and Technology, and NYSTAR. We've collaborated with Lighthouse Guild for the Blind in New York City and have a printing partnership with HP. We've tested our system with over 300 participants, running controlled studies comparing learning ELIA to learning braille or the raised Roman alphabet. We analyzed over 175,000 of the responses from research participants. 
Now, we want to establish ELIA as a mainstream system that will connect people who have lost vision with the rest of society like never before. With this Kickstarter, we will update, streamline, and mass produce our printing technology. 
Andrew and his mom, Elia V. Chepaitis, Ph.D.
ELIA is especially useful for labeling, e.g. for those who take medication for a visual condition.
Why Kickstarter? 
Kickstarter is a great place to introduce a product, because it's a community of early adopters, innovators and creative thinkers. We're hoping this community will support our project by sharing it with those who actually need it most, and may not have access to this platform.
This Kickstarter will serve the most critical needs of people who have a visual impairment—enabling them to retain their literacy, live independently through labeling household items, and learn the skills needed for employment and workplace independence.
Again, your funding support will help us streamline and mass produce our printing technology. From there, we'll begin printing books in the ELIA Frames font, to be distributed to libraries and institutions across the US where readers will be able to read the texts and share them with their community. This will be the first step to establishing ELIA as a system across the country, and around the world.

campaign.story:
The Book
Sneak Preview
Bucky The Dino is a story about a big blue dinosaur with buck teeth who always felt that he was different from all the other dinosaurs.
When his sister, Aggy, would ask him to join her at the park, he would refuse. Whenever he went, he always felt like the odd one out, which made him lonely and sad.
Will Aggy & friends be able to help Bucky with his differences?
Find out what happens next when you purchase the book!
Behind the Story
The very first step I took before I created the storyline, was to do research on the current children's books in the market, as well as ask parents what kind of books they are more inclined to buy. Most said that they enjoy books that have a meaningful moral, and attractive illustrations. As young children are not able to read on their own, they take significant notice to the illustration details on the page while someone else reads to them. For example, the character's facial expression, their body gestures and their characteristic traits.
Through research, I learned that by the age of 3 a child would already understand the basic building blocks of relationships: Love and trust; And this is when children start entering pre-school and making friends. If a child encounters a social situation where he/she feels left out that can significantly affect him/her emotionally and psychologically. As I went around interviewing parents, a mother told me that her daughter who had just entered pre-school had been facing some mood swings. Some days, she would come back elated, because she made a new friend; and on other days, she could be extremely quiet and sad. She even said that once, someone teased her daughter because she wore glasses, and it made her daughter not want to go to school the next day. Upon hearing this story, it inspired me to write a story for kids, about loving themselves for who they are.
In the book, Bucky's differences like his buck teeth and big size made him feel left out. However, his friends prove to him that being different is what makes them unique. I believe that through the story of Bucky The Dino, children would understand that being different is what makes us special.
Please note that these prices do not include the shipping fee.
The Author and The Character
Wilshia
Ever since I was a little girl, I always loved to draw. I wanted to pursue art in college, but I was convinced not to because many said it was not "practical". However, my passion and love for art did not cease. I knew wanted to be a children's book author/illustrator when I rediscovered my love for children's books after reading Dallas Clayton's books. I feel that even as an adult, a children's book still never fails to make me smile. In my heart, I knew I wanted to create children's books that can influence people the way children's book had impacted me, and I worked towards it.
I took up a design minor in college, and external art classes to improve my skills. I also joined the Band of Doodlers in Singapore and started doing murals and drawing gigs. Over the past year, I created the storyline for the book and the full-color illustrations. It took a lot of dedication and hard work, but I did not give up on and continued to push myself to do what I love.
Me drawing a mural with the Band of Doodlers. Spot bucky on the far right :)
Bucky The Dino 
The first drawing I did of Bucky was in the year 2011. He was just a simple doodle on my notebook, but because my friends pointed out how cute he was, I continued drawing him everywhere. In 2015, I knew she wanted the rest of the world to know Bucky, and I wanted to use him to create a positive impact in the world. Hence, I started an Instagram that shared positive quotes with Bucky as the star character. 
In 2016, I had the opportunity to join an art exhibit called the "Seven Deadly Sins" with the Band of Doodlers in Singapore. The artists were placed under each of the seven sins,  and created an artwork surrounding their theme. I created a piece called, Oops, I did it again, under the Gluttony category.
Wilshia and Peter Draw at the "Seven Deadly Sins Exhibit"
As I continue my art journey, I hope to find more ways to help bring awareness to important issues that children face through books. I hope that Bucky can become an icon of positivity to everyone in the world. With your help, we can make this book happen and share this fantastic story so that many kids will not only enjoy reading it, but also understand the importance of loving themselves for who they are. 
My dream is to be a published author-illustrator, and I believe that this will be one of many books to come.
The Support
I want to thank my dad, my mum, my brother and my friends and family who have always supported me in pursuing my dreams.
Especially my high school friends who were my first Bucky supporters; My best friend Jun, who always pushed me to do what I love; Prof Jason for giving me the opportunity to work on this project for this class.
SPREAD THE WORD
  Any questions about Bucky The Dino? Don't hesitate to contact me at buckythedinosaur@gmail.com

campaign.story:
Hippopotomonstrosesquipedalian: Big Words For Little Kids
Hippopotomonstrosesquipedalian (hip-o-pot-o-mon-stro-ses-kwi-ped-a-lee-un) is an extremely long word that means "of, or pertaining to extremely long words." This is an abc book containing super-sized words. Believe it or not, all the words in this book are real words. None of them are made up.
This book is meant to be read by parents to their children. Yes, these words are unusally BIG. They are also fun, wacky, & weird. This book will help put parents & children on an even playing field because the parent will have just as much amusement trying to pronounce these words as their kids will. The comical cartoons illustrating every word will appeal to the child in all of us. When parents show their children that there are so many interesting new things to learn - even when you are an adult - it will influence kids to stay curious and to never stop learning.
I know some of the parents reading this will find these words daunting, even intimidating. But don't worry - I've included a pronunciation guide in the back to help you out.
Does Dad have giant, scary eyebrows? Don't worry - it's only hypertrichophrydia!
 Once printed, this will be a sixty-page, hardcover book. Big words deserve a big book, so the final printed size will be a whopping 11" x 14"! Each letter of the alphabet gets its own spread. Once you see some of these gigantic words, you'll understand why. How could I squeeze a word like "eelogofusciohipoppokunurious" onto only one page? (And if you want to know what that word means, you'll have to buy the book!)
 Rewards
There are several award levels for you to choose from. Choose any of these super-fun things to take home:
Digital Wallpaper - This will come in a variety of sizes to fit almost any device.
Die Cut Sticker - Roughly 4" wide. Stick it on anything!
1.25" Round Button - It's a button! And it's round! Wow!
12" x 18" Poster - Printed on paper. YES! Paper!
Backpack - Get this cool backpack full of goodies! Includes a book, poster, button & sticker!
And of course, the book. Neat-o!
Original Artwork - Get an original page from the book. One-of-a-kind, ink on paper drawings, suitable for framing!
I'm also offering sketches, finished drawings, & even original artwork from the book. All drawings will be done in ink on archival paper. The original art of the book is black & white, done in ink on Bristol board. They are not in color, because I colored the book on the computer. Originals are 28" x 11". All sketches will be in pencil on the inside cover or first page of the book.
Note: All images above (with the exception of the original art) are mockups of the book & reward items. The actual items will look very similar to the above.
A Special Reward Just for Donating!
 I used to make these little figures called doinks. There are each hand-painted & one-of-a-kind. I'm going to give away 5 doinks to people who donate to the Kickstarter campaign. 
Here's how it will work: anyone who donates $10 or more will be entered into the drawing. You get one entry for every $10 you donate. So if you donate $20, you get two chances to win; $100 gets you 10 chances! The more you donate, the better your chance of winning! Everyone who donates will automatically be entered into the drawing, so all you have to do is donate. 
After the Kickstarter campaign is over, I will have a drawing, & 5 people will each win a different doink! You can only win once, sorry. I'll do the drawing via Facebook Live, & I'll announce when the drawing will be a few days before it happens. So if you want one of these, please donate!
Any questions? Please ask. Good luck!
Stretch Goal
Since we've met our goal early, I'll be trying to add some stretch goals to make this project even better. Our first stretch goal is this: if we get to $13,000, everyone who has backed this project at the $10 reward level or more will receive a Hippopotomonstrosesquipedalian coloring book! While you are busy trying to figure out how to pronounce the words in the book, your kids can be coloring some of the artwork from the book. Everybody wins! I'll be coming up with some more stretch goals as we move forward, but, as usual, please send me any ideas you have!
New Reward Level
I've also added a new reward level: the Librarian's Best Friend reward. For $125 (plus a discounted shipping amount) I will donate 3 books to the library of your choice. You will also receive your own copy of the book, along with a poster, a button, & a sticker, just for being a great person! I will ship your goodies to you, & the donated books will be sent directly to the library of your choice. I will include a letter from both of us to each library crediting you or in honor of a person of your choice.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As I stated above, this is a LARGE book. After calling several printers who told me they didn't have adequate equipment to print a book this size, I thought I'd have to shrink it down - which I REALLY didn't want to do. But I finally found a printer that could do the job for a decent price. The only caveat is that they are located in China. Since the book is being printed in China, some delays could inevitably occur. I'm unable to travel overseas for press checks, so they will have to ship me printed samples, which will take some time. Shipping of the final books may also take some time. Rest assured, though, that I'll do everything I can to keep all backers aware of any delays that may occur. I do not anticipate any problems, but if anything arises, I'll be sure to let all backers know in a timely manner.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
